Unfortunately Evelia was unable to pursue a university degree due to a lack of financial resources; but she very much would have liked to have studied international business.

Thanks to her manner of being and her desire to get ahead in life, she makes her living selling cosmetics such as shampoo, perfumes, creams, eyeliners, lipsticks, moisturizing creams, blusher and mascara. She is a street vendor. Evelia's working day involves working some 9 hours a day offering her merchandise, carrying some 20kg to existing and possible customers. This is an activity which Evelia performs with great joy and it has been her way of living as well as that of her two children.


Evelia del Socorro is grateful to the support that the Kiva loan lenders are giving people with scarce financial means, and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital to buy cosmetics such as perfumes, body cream, lipsticks, eyeshadow, blushers and eyeliners.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia's Group

texts.es: Los socios de San Jose Obrero vivan en le comuna Castro y venden ropa nueva para ambos sexos y para todos los edades. Glady tiene 50 años y tiene un negocio de taller de confección en su casa, que se llama confección Gladys. Glady empezó su negocio hace 12 años. Ella aprendió como hacer la confección a través de las revistas y los talleres. Antes trabajaba como profesora de la educación básica, pero a partir de su trabajo en la escuela siempre daba talleres de confección a sus amigas y vecinas. Así le llegó mucho trabajo y cuando se jubilo de ser profesora, decidió dedicarse a su negocio. Ahora ella ensaña clases de confección y el tejido en su casa para las mujeres de su comunidad. Con su préstamo ella va a comprar telas, hilos e hilos de llama. Glady está parada en frente con un globo amarrillo y una blusa morada y negra
texts.en:
The members of San Jose Obrero live in the community of Castro and sell new clothing for men, women, and children. Glady is 50 years old and runs a dressmaking business from her home. The business is called ’Sewing by Gladys'. She started it twelve years ago having learned how to sew through magazines and workshops. Before that she used to be a teacher, but in addition to her work in school, she always gave sewing lessons to her friends and neighbours.

This became a lot of work, so when she retired as a teacher, Glady decided to concentrate on sewing. Nowadays she teaches sewing and knitting in her home to the women of her community. With this loan she will buy fabric, thread, and llama wool.

In the photo Glady is in the front with a yellow balloon and wearing a purple and black blouse.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and llama wool

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира добрая и щедрая женщина. После того, как она вышла замуж для нее началась проблемы с финансами. Она родила 3 детей и занимается их воспитанием. Ее муж не имел постоянную месту работы и Нодира тоже не работала. В этом году ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию и нашел подходящею работу. Дети тоже выросли и теперь Нодира, может заниматься своим делом. Она планирует организовать свой бизнес купле продажей скота, так как она имеет большой огород и вполне может выращивать корм для скота сама и таким образом получать больше дохода.  С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. От данного курса она получила много информации об организации бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nodira is a good and generous woman. After she got married, her financial problems started. She gave birth to three children and raised them. Her husband was not able to keep a stable job and Nodira did not work. 

This year, her husband went to the Russian Federation and found appropriate work. The children also grew up and Nodira can do her work. She plans to set up a new business of buying and reselling livestock, as she has a large garden and is able to grow fodder for the livestock herself. This way she will get more income. 

With this aim she attended the course "Achieve Success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she received a certificate. From this course, she received a lot of information about setting up a business. She requests a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock. She needs and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Nely, de 40 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Donato y sus 2 hijos: Judith y Evelyn a los que cuida en la casa rústica que heredó de sus padres.Sus días son difíciles, pues ella trabaja en la agricultura y ganadería desde pequeña. Además comparte su tiempo con los viajes que realiza a la ciudad de Huancayo donde sus hijas estudian educación superior. “Verlas profesionales es mi mayor orgullo”, afirma. Con esa consigna, trabaja sin descanso en la siembra de maíz, papa y alverja, sus principales sembríos, además de criar 9 vacas que le proporcionan la leche que comercializa diariamente, “la vida en el campo es un trabajo constante”, menciona. Le va muy bien en su negocio, ya que siembra en extensas hectáreas de terrenos agrícolas, las que comercializa a la ciudad, donde obtiene mayores ganancias, además ella misma siembra el alimento a sus vacas.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “San juan” y este es el primer préstamo con MFP , razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico el cual sera distribuido en sus sembríos.
texts.en: Nely, 40, is a humble woman. She lives with her husband Donato and their two children: Judith and Evelyn who they care for in the rustic home that she inherited from her parents. Her days are tough as she has been working in agriculture and livestock from a young age. In addition, she splits her time with trips to the city of Huancayo where her daughters are pursuing upper education. “Seeing them become professionals is my greatest source of pride”, states Nely. With this in mind, she works tirelessly sowing corn, potatoes and peas, her main crops, as well as rearing nine cows which provide her with milk that she sells on a daily basis. “Life in the countryside is an ongoing labor,”, she mentions. Her business is going very well, as she grows crops in vast areas of agricultural plots, which she sells in the city, and where she gains greater profits. She also grows the fodder for her cows. She belongs to the “San Juan” communal bank and this is the 1st loan with MFP, which is why she pledges to meet repayments punctually. She will invest the 1,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles in the purchase of organic fertilizers which she will distribute in her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Leandre

texts.en: Leandre is single and sells phones. He has been selling phones for the period of one year. He wants the loan to buy more phones for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more phones for sale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Fatmata.  She is married and has four children aged 15yrs, 9yrs, 5yrs and 1 year old. In 2006, Fatmata established her soft drinks, alcohol, wine, provisions and cigarettes business. She began her business after her husband gave her starting capital to be supportive at home in terms of domestic affairs. 

Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan in order to buy drinks, provisions and cigarettes. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 600,000. In the future, Fatmata plans to establish a bigger business and also to be a supplier of alcohol and soft drinks.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, provisions and cigarettes.

loans.name: Les Rachetes De Dilaire Group

texts.fr:
Filsaime habite dans la ville de trou du nord d’Haiti où de l’éléctricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Il a dirigé son business pendant les 5 dernières années, Il est le boulanger et a une boulangerie. Il voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans l’achat de la farine, le beurre, les œufs, entre autres produits. 

Filsaime espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à agrandir son business. Il est marié il a 15 enfants. Il est le coordinateur de son groupe Les Rachetes de Dilaire. Des autres membres de Les Rachetes ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre du charbon, du riz et du poisson. 

Filsaime dit que son défi principal est manque d’acheteur constant . Il dit que ses buts principals sont l’augmantation du bussiness. Son rêve est l’achat d’une moto pour transporter les pains.
texts.en:
Filsaime lives in the town Trou-De-Nord, Haiti, where electricity is rare and water is very limited. He is married and has fifteen children. He is a baker, and he owns and has been managing a bakery for the last five years. 

He would like to use this loan to buy flour, butter, eggs, and other goods. Filsaime hopes that this loan will help him expand his business. 

Filsaime is the leader of the group Les Rachetes de Dilaire (The Redeemed from Dilaire). The other members of the group need this loan for their businesses selling coal, rice, and fish. 

Filsaime said that his main challenge is a lack of a steady customer base. He says that his primary goal is the expansion of his business. His dream is to buy a motorcycle to transport bread.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs, and other goods

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is from Pokr Vedi village of Ararat region. She lives with her husband and three sons and is engaged in agriculture.

Tamara keeps livestock which currently includes 4 cows and 30 chickens. She also cultivates wheat and grows apple trees. She has been involved in agriculture for more than 15 years and it has already become part of her life. She works hard to earn a high income and sustain her family. 

Tamara's son Hayk serves in the army and she does her best to save some money to ensure better living conditions for Hayk when he comes back. 

Tamara would like to expand her farm and purchase 10 calves. She has applied for this loan to purchase 10 calves and increase her livestock. The loan is very important for Tamara to be able to earn more income and sustain her family and her farm.

loans.use: to pay for 10 calves

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
El señor orlando josé vive en la cuidad de managua,  lleva el sustento a su familia con los ingreso obtenido por el trabajo realizado como personal de limpieza en un centro de compra de la capital su hora laboral empieza a la 6: am terminado a la 5.PM se caracteriza como una persona responsable con su familia.

don Orlando le esta solicitando  ala fuentes de financiamiento  kiva y ceprodel un crédito ya que quiere hacer un muro en la parte trasera de su vivienda ya que lo considera necesario para la ampliación de su vivienda para darle mayor comodidad  a su familia.

con el préstamo va a comprar bloque,cemento,arena,hierro, se siente muy agradecido por que gracias a los créditos que se le han otorgado ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida para sus hijos y su esposa
texts.en:
Orlando José lives in the city of Managua and he carries the weight of providing for his family with the income he obtains through his work; he is a member of the cleaning staff in a shopping center in the capital.  His work day starts at 6AM and ends at 5PM.  He is characterized as a responsible family man.

Orlando is requesting a loan from the Kiva and Ceprodel financing sources because he wants to put a wall at the rear part of his home; he considers this necessary for the expansion of his home, which would give a greater level of comfort to his family.

With the loan, he is going to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron bars.  He feels very thankful; thanks to the loans that have been granted to him, he has improved the living conditions for his children and wife.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Jose Gregorio vive en la cuidad de managua trabaja en un populoso centro de compra de la capital en el area de limpieza se caracteriza por ser una persona muy responsable en su trabajo y con su familia.
 
esta solicitando un crédito  a ceprodel por medio de kiva por que necesita comprarles a su hijos útiles escolares para el ingreso del año escolar por que su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos hechos  profesionales.

y otra parte del dinero lo utilizara  para  mejorar su vivienda y asi proporcionarles un lugar seguro a su familia.

don jose se siente agradecido por que los crédito que se le han otorgado le han servido para ir construyendo su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Señor Jose Gregorio lives in the city of Managua where he works in a busy commercial centre as a cleaner. He is known as a very responsible person both at work and towards his family. 

Jose is seeking a loan from Ceprodel though Kiva because he needs to buy school supplies for his children as the beginning of the school year is approaching. His greatest dream is to see his children get good jobs. With the rest of the loan money he will make some repairs to his house so that his family will have a safe place to live.

Sr. Jose is very grateful as the loans have allowed him to continue gradually building his house.

loans.use: To pay school fees and buy school supplies

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en: Alphonse is 58 years old. He is married to a businesswoman. They both sell clothes. Alphonse sells fabrics and has been selling fabrics for 12 years. With the loan, he wants to add more fabrics for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.en:
Liliane is 31 years of age. She is married, with two children. Her husband works as a motorcyclist. 

Liliane sells different items, such as lotions, beauty soaps, ladie's pads, and many hygienic products. With the loan, she wants to add more of the aforementioned products. She is planning to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more lotions, beauty soaps, and hygienic products to sell.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 26 years old. She is married to a pastor and they have one child aged four who goes to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more utensils for sale. The profits from the business will be used for putting aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more utensils for sale.

loans.name: Claude

texts.en: Claude is 32 years old. He sells airtime for different phone subscribers. With the loan, he wants to buy more airtime cards for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more airtime cards for sale.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 52 years old, a resident of Nkokonjeru zone, married with twelve children. Eight of the children  whom he looks after go to school. He  provides for their tuition fees  and in addition takes care of his aged mother. 

Rashid operates a bakery which he started in 2002. He supplies his bread and cakes to restaurants, shops, supermarkets and neighbors in surrounding areas. 

Rashid has asked for   a loan of Ugx. 2,000,000 for modifying and expanding his bakery, so that he can  produce better and more bread. He faces challenges of inadequate capital, which affects his production rate, and he  also  has many competitors in the market. He is a hardworking man whose dream is to see all his children have a better education since  he never had formal education and has seen the consequences of not going to school.

loans.use: To add more space to his bakery

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en: Theresie is 41 years old. She is married with four children and they all go to school. With the loan she wants to buy more fabrics for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 29 years old. She sells different merchandise in her boutique. She is married to a motorcyclist and they have both two children. She has requested a loan to buy more sugar, soap, and corn flour for sale. She plans to use the profits for renovating her house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, soap and corn flour for sale.

loans.name: Maksim

texts.ru:
Максим  - фермер. С 2007 года занимается выращиванием винограда, яблок, абрикоса, персика.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает супруга.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с выращивания молодого винограда.
Максим с супругой решили приобрести столбики и проволоку для подвязки молодого винограда.
В планах на будущее:  приобрести трактор, опрыскиватель садовый, фрезу грунтовую и культиватор для вспашки своего земельного участка.
В личных планах: Достроить жилой дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования проволоки и столбиков для винограда
texts.en:
Maksim is a farmer. He has worked with growing grapes, apples, apricots and peaches since 2007. His wife helps him manage the farm. The development of the business started with growing young grapes. 

Maksim and his wife have decided to purchase bars and wire to suspend the young grapes. In the future they plan to purchase a tractor, garden sprayer, dirt blaster and a harrow for plowing the land. In their personal life they plan to build a house to live in. 

They are in need of your help to finance bars and wires for the grapes.

loans.use: To purchase bars and wire for suspending grapes

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 25 years old. She owns a cosmetics boutique and has been running it for four years. She has requested the loan, to buy more deodorants, different types of lotions, and perfumes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build her home.

loans.use: To buy more deodorants, lotions and perfumes for sale.

loans.name: Zhenik

texts.en:
Zhenik is engaged in agriculture. She keeps two cows and five calves, gets milk and uses it in cheese production. She works hard to gather high income and sustain her family. 

Zhenik is 63 years old, but despite her age she is very proactive and a hardworking woman who does her best to cover her family's daily costs. But unfortunately her agricultural income is hardly enough for covering her basic costs and it is very difficult for her to save money for the expansion of the farm. She has applied for this loan to purchase two cows and forage for feeding them. This will help her to get more milk and cheese, and will significantly increase her income.

Zhenik lives with her husband, son and daughter who help her with agriculture.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en: Jeannette is 32 years old. She sells foodstuffs and has been in the business for five years. She has requested a loan to buy more beans, sorghum and corn for sale. The profits from the business will be used to put aside more savings.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as corn flour, sorghum, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Mamur

texts.ru:
Мамур мужчина в возрасте 63 лет.  Женат и имеет троих детей.  Жена домохозяйка.  Сам Мамур занимается выращиванием абрикосов.  Летом он собирает абрикос и сушит их а зимой продает эти сушеные абрикосы на рынке.  Мамур недавно построил новый дом и он хочет установить печь для обогрева зимой. В этом году им пришлось очень тяжело так как их старая печь вышла из строя и не подлежит ремонту.  Было очень холодно.  
Недавно Мамур узнал от своих знакомых,что в Арванде выдают энергосберегающую печь в кредит по продукту "зеленый кредит". Он очень обрадовался,что ему выпала такая возможность приобрести такую печь которая и отапливает  дом, на которой можно готовить еду и печь лепешки.  Его жена тоже была очень рада узнав об этом.  Они решили приобрести эту печь и обратились в организацию Арванд.  
Мамур очень надеется на поддержку от Арванд и осуществление своих планов.
texts.en:
Mamur is a man of the age of 63. He is married and has three children. His wife is a housewife. Mamur works with growing apricots. In the summer he collects apricots and dries them, and in the winter he sells these dry apricots at the market. 

Mamur built a new house not long ago, and he would like to install a stove for winter heating. This winter was very hard for them as their old stove was out of order and could not be repaired. It was very cold. Not long ago, Mamur was told by his acquaintances that "Arvand" issues energy-saving stoves on credit through the product "green credit". He was very happy that he got such an opportunity to purchase such a stove, with which it is possible to both heat the house, prepare food and bake cakes. His wife was also very happy after she discovered this. 

They decided to purchase this stove and turned to the organization "Arvand". Mamur hopes for support from "Arvand" and the realization of his plans.

loans.use: to purchase an energy-saving stove

loans.name: Byron Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Byron vive en Managua casado, actualmente trabaja en una empresa como ordenador  se caracteriza por ser un joven responsable esta estudiando la carrera de derecho  por que considera que al culminar su carrera profesional  va a poder darle un mejor futuro a su familia.

Byron  esta solicitando a kiva y ceprodel financiamiento para realizar pago que tiene pendiente en la universidad y la otra parte de financiamiento lo utilizara para la construcion de un muro en la parte delantera de su casa ya que lo considera nesesario para darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda para la comodida de su familia 
y se siente muy agradecido con ceprodel y sus fuente de financiamiento por que  gracias a eso ha podido poco a poco ir mejorando su casa  y asi brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia ya que su prioridad siempre van a ser su hijos.
texts.en:
Byron is married and lives in Managua.  He currently has a computer-related job at private company.  He is regarded as a responsible young man.  He is pursuing a law degree because he believes this will enable him to provide a better future for his family.

He is seeking a loan from Ceprodel through Kiva so that he can pay his university costs.  He will also use part of the funds for the construction of a wall behind his house, which he feels is necessary to provide greater security for his home and greater comfort for his family.

He is very grateful for the financial support from Ceprodel, as thanks to this he has been able to make improvements to his home little by little and thus provide a better quality of life to his family, since his priority will always be his children.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as concrete blocks, corrugated zinc sheets, and wooden beams.

loans.name: Tebuyoleka Group

texts.en:
This women's group is found in the outskirts of the city and consists of women who formed it with an aim of eradicating poverty from their families. Juliet, a 27-year-old is a single mother of a 4-year-old who has just started kindergarten.She sells electricals--a business she started a year ago with the help of funds from a friend and later additional funds from Ugafode Micro-finance Ltd. Juliet had dropped out of school four years back because her peasant parents could not afford money for her tuition.

With her little savings from the business Juliet bought a small piece of land on which she now wants to begin construction with the loan funds she is acquiring. She hopes that when the house is complete, she will be free from the burden of renting and will use that money to pay tuition for her son. 

 Juliet is faced with challenges of insecurity because thieves steal her goods in the night at times. However she is persistent and confident that all this will change and her business will grow to self-sustainability.The ninth person is the group chairperson who is not taking out a loan this cycle but signed a waiver form.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her residential house.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 32 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for seven years. She is married with three children. She sells vegetables and has requested a loan to buy more vegetables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale such as tomatoes, cabbages and eggplants.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité es un grupo muy activo,  el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo 1º,  ya que el comité empieza como grupo nuevo que quiere trabajar y salir adelante por medio del trabajo de cada una.
La Sra. Teresa es la tesorera del grupo, ella es costurera y realiza manteles, sabanas y muchas cosas mas y cuenta que con el correr del tiempo desea  que crezca su negocio y poner otras cosas mas con lo que ya tiene con su esfuerzo y también gracias a la  Fundación Paraguaya . Ella vive en Guarambare con sus hijos  y  siempre trata de  salir adelante. La Sra. Desea tener  su propio negocio con el correr de los años y así también ayudar a otras personas con fuentes de trabajo.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones y demás, con lo que podrá seguir haciendo sus confecciones y cumpliendo con pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
This committee is an active group that is in its first loan cycle. This is a new group that wants to work and move forward through the efforts of each of its members.

Sra. Teresa is the group treasurer. She is a seamstress who produces tablecloths, bed sheets, and many other items. As time passes, she wants to grow her business and offer other things through her own efforts and also with the help of Fundación Paraguaya.

Teresa lives in Guarambare with her children, so she is always trying to get ahead. She wants to keep her business over many years so that she can help other people by providing jobs. Teresa is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies so that she can continue sewing and fulfilling her outstanding orders.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sobir

texts.ru:
Собир молодой общительный,трудолюбивый  парень.  Он женат и имеет одного ребенка.  Жена пока негде не работает так как их ребенок маленький.  Собир плотник. Этим видом деятельности он занимается семь лет. Он производит столы и стулья.  Среди своих соседей и знакомых  пользуется большим авторитетам и признан ими как честный и сдержанный мужчина, он хороший семьянин и не имеет  вредных привычек. Как благородный мужчина и отец, Собир хочет построить своему сыну дом и хочет чтобы его сын в будущем не в чем не нуждался. За семь лет он накопил денежных средств для стройки дома но все равно ему не хватает на такие крупные расходы.  
 По совету своих знакомых он обратился за финансовой поддержкой в организацию Арванд за кредитом.  Собир на полученный кредит планирует купить строительных материалов и построить большой дом для своего единственного сына.  Не смотря на свою молодость Собир уже посадил несколько деревьев, воспитывает  сына и конечно же как настоящий мужчина построит дом. Ведь мудрые люди говорили:"Настоящий мужчина должен посадить дерево,вырастить сына и построить дом.
texts.en:
Sobir is a young, sociable, hard-working guy. He is married and has one child. His wife does not yet work anywhere, as their child is small. Sobir is a carpenter. He has worked with this type of business for seven years. He produces tables and chairs. He is highly respected and recognized as an honest and discreet man among his neighbors and acquaintances. He is a good family man and does not have any bad habits. 

As a thankful man and father, Sobir would like to build his son a house and not be in need of anything in the future. He saved up money for seven years to build the house, but he still does not have enough money for such large expenditures. At the advice of his acquaintances he turned to the "Arvand" organization for financial support. Sobir plans to use the loan received to purchase building materials and build a big house for his only son. 

Despite his young age, Sobir has already planted a few trees, he is raising a son and of course, like a real man, is building a house. Because as wise people have said: "A real man should plant trees, raise his son and build a house".

loans.use: to purchase building materials

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza, who is 34 years old and lives with her mother in Zuygaxbyur, a village in the Shirak region, runs a farm which currently includes 12 cows, 10 sheep and 10 chickens. She also cultivates wheat, barley and grass. Tereza does her best to earn a high income and sustain her mother's living. As the only breadwinner in the family, she works hard to cover daily costs and at the same time run the farm.

Because it is very difficult for her to save money and cover operational costs, Tereza has applied for a loan to purchase forage to feed the livestock. The loan is very important for her as she strives to ensure a better life for her mother.

loans.use: to pay for forage to feed the livestock.

loans.name: 29 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 29 de Setiembre, está en su ciclo número 13 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Myrian, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo está saliendo adelante. Es una persona que desde joven ha trabajado y no teme hacerlo. Ella trabaja  como empleada en un Hotel, y también se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de comidas, como se ve, ella es muy trabajadora.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de productos varios para sus venta de comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos y demás lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group, September 29, is in its 13th cycle of the program of the committee of women.  They all work and help each other to get ahead.

One of the members of the group is Myrian.  Through her efforts and continuous work, she is moving forward. Myrian is a person who has worked since she was young and is not afraid to work. She works as a maid in a hotel, and also sells all kinds of foods.  As you can see, she is very hardworking.

Myrian is requesting this loan to purchase multiple products to sell food, such as vegetables, meats, spices, etc. This will help her realize her business plan, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, and other seasonings.

loans.name: Cristian Miguel

texts.es: Cristian Miguel, de 22 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo y vive con su esposa e hijo en una aldea del municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace 3 años que el comenzó con su propio negocio de compra y venta de cerdos y carne de cerdo. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en la aldea y sus alrededores. El préstamo que solicita es por 9,000 Lempiras y lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos para destazo y vender la carne. Su meta es aumentar las ventas para satisfacer las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Cristian Miguel is 22 years old, married, and has one child. He lives with his family in a neighborhood in the town of Morazán, Yoro.

Three years ago, Cristian started his own business of buying and selling pigs and also selling pork. He conducts his business as a traveling merchant in his neighborhood and the surrounding areas. The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 9,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of pigs for butchering and to sell the meat. His goal is to increase his sales so that he can meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering in order to sell the meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: in a land rental.

loans.name: Sorie Baimba's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers from one of the primary schools in Koidu. They have come to Kiva field partner Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) in order to request a loan of 12,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones for the entire group. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. For example, some of them will use this loan to pay school fees for their children, others will use it to buy house building materials, some will invest theirs in businesses, etc., etc. And at the end of each month, they can use their monthly salaries to repay the loan. It is their school bursar whose responsibility it is to deduct the repayments and repay SMT/Kiva lenders on the teachers' behalf.

Sorie is the featured leader of this group. A native of Manjoro village in northern Sierra Leone, the 59-year-old is married to a teacher and the two have six children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Sorie has been a professional teacher for 38 years now. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cement, etc. for the construction of a dwelling house

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 30-year-old Mariama from Kandeh Town in Bo.  She is married with four children, aged 3 to 17 years old.  Her husband is a farmer and helps support the family.  Mariama started her business to help with her home.  

Mariama owns a shop selling clothes, shoes and other miscellaneous items.   She works 14 hours per day, 7 days per week at her business.   One of her greatest challenges is the transportation cost.  She requested this loan to purchase more stock such as palm oil, clothes and shoes.  She wants to use the extra income from the loan to pay for the education of her children.  She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as palm oil, clothes and shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old and widowed with five children, two of whom are currently attending school.  She runs a stall in Kandeh Town in Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone.  

She owns a stall in the market selling palm oil, 'gari' (manioc couscous) and rice.  She also goes to people’s home to sell her products.  Her business is open throughout the week.  She entered into business because her mother was also a businesswoman.  She also wants to help earn more income to educate her children and help replace her late husband.   Her business is going well and every day she is getting new customers.

With this loan, she wants to purchase more inventory such as palm oil, 'gari' and rice to increase her business.  In the next five years, she wants to see her stall expand into a stand-alone shop.  She wants to use the extra income to educate her children and further expand her business.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as palm oil, 'gari' and rice to expand her business

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es:
Julio, tiene 55 años de edad, está casado y su esposa tiene 50 años de edad, tienen una hija que vive con ellos y les ayuda económicamente, Julio es transportista, tiene un vehículo con el que realiza viajes, tiene ya 15 años en este oficio.
Él solicita un préstamo porque necesita darle mantenimiento al vehículo, comprando llantas y revisión donde el mecánico, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar las condiciones de vehículo, ya que es a través de él que trabaja para su familia y poder obtener ingresos. 
La aspiración de Julio es tener en buenas condiciones su medio de trabajo, ya que esto le dará mas seguridad para brindar un mejor servicio a los clientes y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 55 years old. He is married to his 50-year-old wife. Together they have one daughter that lives with them and helps them financially. Julio has worked in transportation for 15 years. He has his own vehicle that he uses and he is requesting a loan because he needs to do some maintenance work on it. Julio will buy tires for his truck and pay a mechanic to work on it. This will help him to improve the condition of the truck that he depends on to provide for his family. 

Julio aspires to have his truck in good working order, which will give him more security and allow him to offer better service to his customers. This will help him to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires and to pay a mechanic.

loans.name: Inna

texts.ru:
Инна замужем. У нее есть маленькие дети. Она имеет свой бизнес.
Инна занимается тепличным хозяйством на протяжении 3 трех лет. Наиболее продаваемые товары: ранние и поздние огурцы. Инна ответственна и трудолюбивая. Она является членом поместной церкви.
Инна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20000 гривен на покупку семян, пленки, удобрений, дров и на установку отопления. Кредит поможет ей подготовиться к весеннему сезону. Дополнительную прибыль хочет потратить на нужды семьи.
texts.en:
Inna is married. She has small children. She has her own business. Inna has worked with greenhouse farming for a period of three years. The best products to sell are early and late cucumbers. 

Inna is responsible and hard-working. She is part of the local church. Inna requests a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia for the purchase of seeds, plastic film, fertilizer, wood and installation of heating. The loan helps her prepare for the spring. She wants to spend the additional income on the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic film, fertilizers and wood for greenhouses

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en Santiago y vende cosas para el hogar desde su casa. Vende Sabanas, bajados de cama, plumones, cortinas. Hace 6 años que empezó con su negocio, con un préstamo y el apoyo de Fondo Esperanza ha podido crecer su negocio y amplia la clientela. Ahora vende ropa, juguetes. A Juana le gusta tener su propio negocio porque le ha permitido ganar un sueldo mejor y ser más independiente. Ella se siente cómoda en su trabajo y le gusta trabajar. 
Con su préstamo Juana quisiera ampliar sus existencias y comprar Sabanas, bajados de cama, plumones, cortinas. Está casada y  tiene una hija mayor.
texts.en:
Juana lives in Chile and sells home products from her house. She sells sheets, down bedding, flock-beds, and curtains. It has been six years since she began her business. With a loan and the support of Fondo Esperanza ("Hope Fund") she has been able to expand her business and clients. Now she sells clothes and toys. Juana likes to have her own business because it has permitted her to gain a better wage and be more independent. She feels comfortable with her work and enjoys it.

With this loan Juana would like to expand her home and buy sheets, down bedding, flock-beds, and curtains. She is married and has an adult daughter.

loans.use: to expand her home and buy sheets, down bedding, flock-beds, and curtains.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 34 years old. She sells various items in her boutique. She is married with five children and four of them go to school. With the loan, she wants to buy more items to sell. She will expand her business using the profits. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was also to add more items to sell in her boutique. She qualified for another loan cycle and has bought more items to expand the volume of her store. Such goods include soaps, cooking oil, utensils and many more.

loans.use: To buy more boutique items for sale such as soaps, cooking oil, utensils and many more.

loans.name: Mariane

texts.en:
Mariane is the mother of five children aged between 8 and 17. She owns a boutique that she has been running for two years. 

She wants the loan to buy more items to sell, such as sugar, salt, soaps and cooking oil. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: To buy more retail items such as sugar, salt, soaps and cooking oil to sell in her boutique.

loans.name: Sahr Victor's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org is very pleased to present to you this group of able and dedicated teachers from the city of Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. This group of teachers has applied for a loan of 15,300,000 SLL in order to meet their immediate and most pressing financial needs. At the end of each month, the group can easily repay their loan using their monthly salaries. It is their school’s bursar who is directly responsible for making the repayments on their behalf. 

Sahr Edward is the featured leader of this group. A native of Yengema, the 54-year-old is married to a housewife. The couple has 6 children, 3 of whom are attending secondary schools. Sahr Edward has been a school teacher for 28 years now. He has requested this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

(Also included in the photo is David. He was a member of the team but is not collecting a loan this time).

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Abdias

texts.es: Abdias, de 24 años es un hombre responsable, vive en compañía de su esposa Gisela y su hija Adriana en la casa que le heredarón sus padres. Hace 5 años cuando formó su familia y las responsabilidades crecieron, decidió abrir un taller de planchado y pintado de carros, según comenta gusta mucho de este oficio, pues sus padres alquilaban la casa a otros negociantes que tenían el mismo negocio, “mirando sus trabajos, aprendí y decidí realizar lo mismo”, afirma. Desde entonces le fue muy bien en este negocio, tiene clientes fijos y espera poder comprar las maquinarias para poder realizar un trabajo de nivel y así ganar más dinero, ya que no tiene mucha competencia. En esta oportunidad solictará 1000 soles para la compra de pintura ,oxígeno, lija y demás insumos para realizar su trabajo, a la vez se  compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron la responsabilidad y trabajo arduo.
texts.en:
24 year-old Abdias is a responsible man who lives with his wife, Gisela and his daughter Adriana in the house they inherited from his parents. 

5 years ago when he started his family and his responsibilities grew, he decided to open a car painting and planishing workshop. He says he likes this craft a lot. His parents rented the house to other businessmen who had the same business. "Looking at their work, I learned, and I decided to do the same," he says. 

Since then he has gone really well in this business; he's got fixed customers and hopes to be able to buy the machinery to carry out skilled work and therefore earn more money because he hasn't got much skill. 

He is applying for the opportunity to borrow 1000 soles to buy paint, oxygen, sandpaper and other supplies to do his work. At the same time he promises to be punctual with the payments of his installments because he has learnt to be hard-working and responsible.

loans.use: to buy paint and other reparation materials

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, quiere continuar trabajando y mejorando el negocio, por eso tiene la iniciativa de continuar solicitando préstamo para realizar la compra de maíz, leña, verduras, entre otros que sean necesarios para mantener el negocio estable, incurrira en verduras frescas para ofrecer a los clientes.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior, le ayudo a que su negocio contara con lo necesario para la venta, obtuvo una aceptación de los clientes, sus condiciones en la familia han mejorado a través del funcionamiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Reina wants to keep working and improving her business. For this reason, she is requesting another loan to buy corn, firewood, vegetables, and other necessary items to keep her business stable. She will also buy fresh vegetables to offer her customers. 

Reina's last loan helped her to keep her business well-stocked. Many customers are happy with it and her family's situation has improved as her business has become more successful.

loans.use: to buy corn, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Namina

texts.en:
Greetings from Bo, Sierra Leone! Namina is 47 years old, married with four children.  She sells groundnuts at a big market in Kulandah Town.  

She works at her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week.  She went into business because her parents could not afford to educate her.  Now, she has two employees working in her business.  The biggest challenge in her business is that sometimes the groundnuts get spoilt. 

Namina requested this loan to buy more groundnuts to expand her business.   In five years, she wants to finally own a shop.  This loan will help her educate her children with the proceeds of her business.  She appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more groundnuts to expand her business

loans.name: Garnik

texts.en:
Garnik is from the Armavir region. He works in agriculture. He has 3 pigs, 50 chickens, and 45 colonies of bees. Garnik also owns agricultural land where he cultivates cucumbers, onions, and watermelons. He works hard to gather good honey and to sell it in the local markets. Due to his hard work, his honey is in high demand amongst buyers.
 
As agriculture helps Garnik to gather income and helps to cover his family's costs, Garnik would like to expand his farm. He has applied for this loan to purchase two bulls, fertilizer, and to cover fuel costs. This is very important for Garnik as he has no sufficient funds to cover fuel costs to take his product to the market.

Garnik lives with his wife and 3 sons. The loan is very important for Garnik to expand his farm and be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for two bulls, fertilizer, and to cover fuel costs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр женат. У него есть дети школьного и студенческого возраста. Александр имеет свой бизнес.
Александр занимается тепличным хозяйством. Его  опыт работы составляет 10 лет. Наиболее продаваемыми являются ранние и поздние огурцы, помидоры. Александр целеустремленный и ответственный. Он член поместной церкви.

Александр просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на покупку дров, удобрений и химикатов, а также на оплату труда наемным работникам на высадку рассады в теплицы.  Кредит поможет ему подготовиться к предстоящему сезону.
texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has children of school and student age. Alexander has his own business. Alexander works with greenhouse farming. He has 10 years of work experience. The bestselling products are early and late cucumbers and tomatoes. 

Alexander is a purposeful and responsible man. He is part of the local church. Alexander requests a loan in the amount of 15,000 hryvnia for the purchase of wood, fertilizers and chemicals, and further to pay for hired work for planting seedlings in the greenhouses. The loan helps him prepare for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to purchase wood, fertilizers and pay for workers

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr:
Alphonsine a 47 ans, elle est divorcée, , elle a 5 enfants, le plus agé a 26 ans et le moins agé a 13 ans. 4 vont à l`école. ella le niveau d`étude de 6 eme sécondaire. elle sollicite cet emprunt pour acheter le cables électrique pour sa maison ,payer le main  d`oeuvre et acheter le cash power.

elle n`attend aucunes difficultés pour rembourser ce crédit.la stratégie pour accroitre son affaire est de construire une maison de qualité, son ambition est d`augmenter ses niveau des étude ,pour la famille c`est le bien être.
texts.en:
Alphonsine is 47 years old and divorced, and she has five children. The oldest is 26 years old, and the youngest is 13. Four of them go to school. She has a 6th grade education. She is requesting this loan to purchase electrical cables for her house, pay for labor, and purchase 'cash power'. 

She expects no difficulties at all in paying back this loan. Her strategy for growing her business is to build a quality house. Her ambition is to get more education, and for her family, it is to ensure its well-being.

loans.use: to purchase electrical cables

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Restauratrice de profession, Salissou est âgée de 35ans. Elle a pour conjoint un transitaire et ont 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés. C’est pour contribuer aux dépenses du foyer qu’elle a démarré cette activité en 2012. Elle achète les matières premières dont elle a besoin (tomate, riz, huile végétale et autres) chez des grossistes au grand marché de Lomé et les transforme en nourriture pour servir ses nombreux. Afin d’augmenter sa quantité considérable de matières premières, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES  pour s’en approvisionner. Elle compte agrandir son activité et permettre à ses enfants de mieux s’épanouir.
texts.en: A professional cook, Salissou is 35 years old. Her husband is a freight agent and they have five children, of whom three are in school. In order to contribute to family expenditures, Salissou began her work in 2012. She buys the raw materials she needs (tomatoes, rice, vegetable oil, etc.)  from wholesalers in the Grand Market of Lomé and transforms them into cooked food to serve her numerous clientele. In order to add to her considerable quantity of raw ingredients, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES to use for stocking up. She intends to expand her activity and allow her children to flourish.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Please meet 50-year-old Alice.  She is married with four children, with the youngest being 14 years old.  Three of her children currently go to school.  

Alice owns a small eatery that also sells drinks and cell phone top-up cards in Torkpoi Town, Bo.  She works for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week at her business.  She wants to use the loan to purchase more food items, drinks and top-up cards to grow her business.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more food items, drinks and top-up cards for phones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insecticides, liquid weed killer, Ranger, herbicides and urea.

loans.name: Massah

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 47-year-old Massah. She is from Torkpoi Town in Bo, located in the south of the country. She is widowed with 8 children.

Massah owns a restaurant and also sells soap at her business. She works 9 hours a day, every day of the week, at her business. She started her business to educate her children and to engage herself. She says that sometimes business is difficult. She plans to use the loan to buy more soap and foodstuff. She hopes to use the loan to grow her business. 

Your support is greatly appreciated!

loans.use: to buy more soap and foodstuff

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Please meet Josephine from Sierra Leone. She is 27 years old and is married with two children, ages 2 and 5.  Her oldest child currently attends school.

Josephine owns a business selling palm oil, wood, and rice from her home. She works diligently at her business for 10 hours a day, 6 days a week. She started her business initially to engage herself and to educate her children. She was a housewife before. 

Josephine wants to use the loan to purchase more palm oil, wood, and rice for her business. She wants to see the business get bigger and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, wood, and rice

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36 year old Kumba from Torkpoi Town in Bo, located in the southern region of the country. She is married with two children, the youngest being 10 years old. Kumba owns a cafe where she works for nine hours every day, six days a week. She requested the loan to buy more rice, pure water and cigarettes for her business to sell. She started her business to engage herself and not depend on others. Before this she was a housewife. She says that sometimes business is difficult. She hopes to see her business expand and help pay for her child.  She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more rice, pure water and cigarettes for her business to sell

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es:
Paulino, de 42 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Juana y sus 4 hijos a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 12 años. En las mañanas se dedica a manejar su mototaxi, “en días de cosecha dejó de trabajar en el trasporte y me voy a la chacra, el vehículo me ayuda en transportarme”, afirma. Ya que su principal actividad económica se centra en la agricultura, posee sus propios terrenos agrícolas a varias horas de su hogar, por lo que sale muy temprano a trabajar. Tiene 20 años de experiencia y aprendió este oficio cuando era aun un niño, “sembraba y tenía mis animales, pero me trasladé a vivir en la ciudad por los estudios de mis hijos, dejé de dedicarme a la agricultura, ahí obtuve mi motocarro, ahora comencé a sembrar nuevamente, pues ya tengo el capital que necesitaba”, afirma. Esta muy agradecido con el apoyo económico que le brinda nuestra empresa razon por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que le enseñarón a ser responsable.
Paulino, invertirá los 800.00 soles  en la compra de abono orgánico para distribuir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Paulino, 42 years old, is a hardworking man. He lives with his wife, Juana, and their four children in a house they bought 12 years ago. In the mornings, Paulino works as a taxi driver, "On harvesting days, I stop working in transportation and I take my vehicle to the farm," he affirms. 

Since his principal source of income is farming, Paulino has his own plots of land located a few hours away from his house. For this reason, he leaves very early in the morning to work. He has 20 years of experience since he learned this trade when he was a young boy. "I farmed and had my own animals, but I moved to the city so that my children could study. I stopped working in agriculture and obtained by vehicle. I am beginning to work in agriculture again, now that I have the capital that I needed." 

Paulino is very grateful for the financial support he receives from this communal bank. He promises to be punctual with his repayments since he has already learned the importance of being responsible. 

Paulino will invest the 800 soles to buy organic fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Meet Fatmata from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone.  She is 23 years old and married with one child, aged 3. Fatmata sells palm oil and works six days a week, nine hours each day at her business.  She wants to use the loan to purchase more palm oil to grow her business.  She says that sometimes business is difficult.  She wishes to increase her business and help pay for her child.  She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more palm oil

loans.name: Neomi

texts.en: This is 50 year old Neomi from Bo, Sierra Leone in the southern region of the country. She is married with four children. She owns a business that sells coal and drinks in Torkpoi Town. She was a housewife before and started the business to engage herself.  She works at her business for six hours a day, seven days a week.  She says that sometimes business is tough. She requested the loan to purchase more cool drinks to grow her business. In the next five years, she would like to see the business continue to expand and improve. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to grow her business

loans.name: Almast

texts.en:
Almast is engaged in agriculture. She keeps four cows and 80 sheep. Almast has been involved in agriculture for more than fifteen years, and it has become a part of her life. She breeds cattle to get milk which she uses in cheese production. Due to her hard work, her cheese is in strong demand among the buyers. Almast works hard to meet her clients' demand and sustain her family. As agriculture helps Almast to get income and cover her family's daily costs she would like to expand the business. Almast has applied for this loan to purchase two bulls and forage for feeding the livestock.
The loan is very important for her to increase her livestock, feed the animals and earn more income. Almast lives with her husband and 19-year-old daughter. Almast does her best to ensure a better life for her husband and daughter.

loans.use: To pay for two bulls and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Tigidanky

texts.en: This is Tigidanky from Torkpoi Town in Bo, in the south of Sierra Leone.  She is married with six children, the youngest being eight years old. Her husband is a laborer and also contributes to the family. Tigidanky owns a business that sells personal items such as creams, soaps and toothpaste.  She works eight hours per day, seven days per week in her business.  She requested this loan to purchase more inventory to expand her business.  She hopes to see her business continue to grow in the future.  She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as creams, soaps and toothpaste

loans.name: Banco Mujer En Progreso Group

texts.es: Yesenia es la tesorera de Banco Mujer En Progreso, tiene 32 años, 3 hijos menores de edad y vive en unión libre hace más de 7 años. Ella es una comerciante con mucha experiencia y a través de los años ha logrado consolidar su negocio y aumentar su cartera de clientas.  Su actividad es la distribución al por mayor de recipientes plásticos de cocina, y también la venta ambulante de los mismos artículos por unidad. Este es el cuarto crédito que solicita y nos cuenta que los financiamientos de Fundación Mujer son los que le permitieron fortalecer su negocio.  Y este préstamo será invertido en los mismos recipientes plásticos que se vende muy bien. Entre sus proyectos están seguir creciendo y distribuir en otras comunidades los productos, aumentar sus ingresos económicos y con ello mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. El grupo lo integran un total de 9 señoras que van a invertir en actividades comerciales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is the treasurer of Banco Mujer En Progreso (Women in Progress Bank). She is 32 years old and has three young children. She has been civilly married for more than seven years. Yesenia is a saleswoman with much experience. Over the years, she has been able to strengthen her business and increase her clients. She works selling plastic kitchen containers in bulk as well as individually in door-to-door sales. 

This is Yesenia's fourth loan. She says that the loans from Fundación Mujer (Women's Foundation) have helped her to strengthen her business. Yesenia will invest this loan to purchase more of the plastic containers that are in higher demand. She plans to continue growing and selling her products in other communities. She aims to increase her profits, and thus improve her family's quality of life. 

This group is composed of nine women who will invest in other businesses as well.

loans.use: to buy plastic kitchen containers to sell in bulk.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Please meet Margaret from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone.  She is 38 years old and married with four children, aged 4 to 22.  All four of her children currently attend school. Margaret operates a business six days per week selling palm oil, gari and wood from her house. She started her business to improve herself and educate her children.  She says that getting a vehicle to take her while she is carrying her inventory is difficult and is a challenge she faces in the business.  She requested this loan to purchase more palm oil, wood and gari for her business.  In five years, she hopes to be able to own her own shop. She wants to use the profits from her business to educate her children and provide for her family.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, wood and gari for her business

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Greetings from Bo, Sierra Leone!  Please meet 48-year-old Mamie from Torkpoi Town in Bo, located in the southern part of the country. She is married and has four children, with the youngest one being 7 years old.  

Mamie sells wood, charcoal and palm oil from her house. She works 12 hours per day, 5 days per week at her business. She started her business to help educate her children. She says that the cost of transportation and her inventory are major challenges for her business.

She requested the loan to purchase more wood, palm oil and charcoal for her business. She hopes to continue to see the business grow and use the proceeds to pay her children’s school fees.  

Mamie wants to say a big thank you to BRAC and Kiva for helping the women of Sierra Leone.

loans.use: to purchase more wood, palm oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Christiana from Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children, all between the ages of 2 and 9.  Two of her children are going to school. 
Christiana has a business that sells foodstuff such as palm oil, groundnuts, onions, and peppers in Torkpoi Town in Bo. She works at her business 9 hours a day, 6 days a week. She started her business to engage herself so that she does not need to depend on others. She says that her main challenge is transportation.

She wants to use the loan to purchase more stock including okra, palm oil, peppers, and sesame. With the extra income from the business, she wants to educate her children and grow her business. She greatly appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock including okra, palm oil, pepper, and sesame

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Please meet 48-year-old Jeneba from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently going to school. 
 
Jeneba owns a business selling fish and oil. She works nine hours a day, five days a week at her business. She started her business to engage herself and educate her children. She requested the loan to buy more fish and oil.  

She says that transportation is a big challenge. At times, the vehicle will break down on the way, and she will need to sleep by the road until the next day to find her way back. With the loan, she hopes to increase her business and pay her children’s school fees. She greatly appreciates your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish and oil

loans.name: Augusta H.

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Augusta from Torkpoi Town in Bo, Sierra Leone. She is married with four children, between the ages of nine and 24. Three of her children currently attend school.

Augusta sells rubber and wood from her house and works seven hours a day, five days a week at her business. She started her business to improve herself and to educate her children. She requested the loan to buy more stock, such as rubber and wood, for her business. She says that transportation is high, and the prices of wood and rubber rise and fall, making her business more unpredictable.  

The client wants to use the proceeds of her business to feed her family and pay her children’s school fees. She thanks you for helping her business improve.

loans.use: to buy more stock, such as rubber and wood, for her business

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 38-year-old widow with three children.

Analyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, egg, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

Analyn has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a rice retail business.

Analyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store and rice retailing business.

Analyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, spices, egg, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is married with four children. She is 42 years of age and lives in Purok Makiangayon Blancia Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.
Marcelina sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 13 years. Each month, she earns 3,700 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to to purchase more dried fish for her retail business. 

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost one year. In the future, Marcelina hopes to expand her business and become successful.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza works hard to support her family. She is married and has a banana business in the Philippines. Analiza has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years now.
In the future, Analiza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Renny Boy

texts.en:
Renny is 39 years of age and lives in Sominot Zamboanga del Sur. He is married with two children.
Renny has a pig raising business. He earns about 20,000 PHP every four months from the business. Renny has requested a loan to purchase more pigs.
Renny has been a member of Paglaum MPC for one year. In the future, Renny hopes to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs for his piggery business

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 56 years old and lives in San Isidro, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Liza has a general store and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to  purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

Liza has been a member of PMPC for almost six years. In the future, Liza hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, salt, and vinegar.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 56 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Concepcion has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

Concepcion has been in this business for six years. In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, canned goods, milk, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kitchen wares to sell

loans.name: Elna Fe

texts.en:
Elna Fe is 28 years old and lives in Cabangcalan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Elna Fe has an eatery business. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Elna Fe has requested a loan to purchase more raw  ingredients for her eatery business.

Elna Fe became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Elna Fe would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw  ingredients for her eatery business.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is married with seven children. Lerma is 50 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.
Lerma owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 5000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store such as toothpaste, soaps and shampoo. Lerma has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store  such as toothpaste, soaps and shampoo

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 47 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.
Myrna works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell.
Myrna has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Myrna hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is married with one child. Cecil is 33 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
Cecil sells clothes to earn a living and had this business for 13 years. Each month, he earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more clothes for his retail business. Cecil joined PMPC this year. In the future, Cecil hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for his retail business

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 53 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children. Rosie works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more fish to sell in her retail business.
Rosie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Rosie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her retail business.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Divina requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, sugar, milk, spices, eggs and noodles. Divina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, sugar, milk, spices, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 40 años pero tiene la vitalidad de un joven de 20 años, ya que el trabajo es su herramienta para vivir lleno de vitalidad, la vivienda donde habita Marco se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que cuenta con muchos atractivos turísticos y se puede apreciar la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, esparrago, entre otros. Marco una razón muy importante para luchar cada día y esa es su familia, el vive al lado de su esposa y de sus hijos a quienes ama muchísimo y a pesar de las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado sigue unido más que nunca a su familia. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Marco solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Medicina Humana.

Día a día Marco lucha para sacar a su familia adelante y lo hace con su pequeño y humilde negocio e lavado de autos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes de manera diaria; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y porque su familia es el motor y la mejor motivación de lucha.

Marco está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá comprar un nuevo triciclo para cargar los baldes de agua que utiliza para lavar los autos, así como también una sillas nuevas para poder ofrecer una mejor comodidad a sus clientes ya que las que tiene actualmente son viejas, así podrá mejorar cada día y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y ofrecerles una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Marco is a very hardworking man.  He's 40 but has the vitality of a 20-year-old young man because work is his tool to live full of vitality.  The house where Marco lives is in the city of Ica, where there are a lot of tourist attractions and agriculture, especially cotton, paprika, asparagus, and other crops.

One very important reason for Marco to strive every day is his family.  He lives with his wife and children, whom he loves a lot.  Despite the adversities he has faced in life, he continues to be closer than ever to his family.  Because of his scarce economic resources Marco only managed to study  up to the fifth year of secondary school, but he would like to have studied the field of human medicine.

Every day Marco strives to get his family ahead, which he does with his small and modest car-washing business.  He works about 10 hours a day and can serve up to 10 customers.  He believes he's getting ahead in his business because he's friendly with the customers and because his family is the driving force and best motivation for striving.

Marco is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to buy a new tricycle to carry the pails of water he uses to wash the cars.  He'll also buy some new chairs so his customers will be more comfortable because the ones he has now are old.

This way he'll be able to improve every day and continue striving to be able to make his biggest dream a reality: "To have his own house and to give his children a good education."

loans.use: to buy a tricycle

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 50, married, and has one child. She lives in Lumbayao, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Flora sells bananas to earn a living, and had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more bananas to sell. Flora has been a member of PMPC for three years. 

In the future, Flora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane’s group comprises five women who are mostly widows.  Their average age is 40 years, and each has four children. They all live in the same village – Kyakatebe - and they are active members of YICE's women self-help groups in that village. All members in this group are small-scale farmers, growing vegetables like tomatoes, eggplants, onions, and green peppers for sale in their village market.

Jane (first from left), is 41 years old and she has been this group leader for one year. She earns her income through sales of her vegetables, although she believes that reaps less than expected due to poor-quality yields.

Jane and her group members attended YICE’s farming-as-business trainings and acquired skills to increase her vegetable quality and yields. She now asks for a loan to buy good quality vegetable seeds and fertilizers and also to access more training on vegetable production to increase her yields, earn extra income, and position herself to take good care of her family.

Jane has a dream of becoming a model farmer for vegetable growing in her village.

loans.use: To buy good quality vegetable seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 30 años es un hombre trabajador y muy alegre. Vive en compañía de su esposa Sarita con quien tiene 2 hijos: Judith y Guillermo, con quienes vive en la casa de su tía desde hace 4 años. Desde los 18 años trabajó sin descanso en la agricultura, pues siempre cuidó de sus padres. Cuando formó su propia familia pensó en obtener ingresos constantes y poder vivir en la ciudad, razón por la cual compro su mototaxi , desde entonces trabaja sin descanso durante todos el día , ya que desea tener su casa propia. Durante estos años le fue bien, tanto así que compró otro motocarro más , con el que enseñó a manejar a su esposa y poder juntos trabajar en el trasporte de personas por los alrededores de la ciudad, ahora trabaja mucho más por lo que tiene que brindarle mantenimiento constante a amabos mototaxis, espera poder seguir ahorrando y comprar más mototaxis, su sueño es abrir su propia empresa de trasporte. En esta oportunidad solictará S/.500 soles para la compra de llantas nuevas y una toldera para mejorar su motortaxi , a su vez se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de maneral puntual y responsable.
texts.en: Edwin, age 30, is a hard-working and very cheerful man. He lives in the company of his wife, Sarita, with whom he has 2 children, Judith and Guillermo. Together with them, he has lived in the home of his aunt for 4 years. Since he was 18, he worked tirelessly in agriculture, since he always took care of his parents. When he started his own family, he thought about obtaining a steady income and being able to live in the city, and for that reason he bought his moto-taxi. Since then, he has been working without rest every day, since he wants to have a house of his own. During these years, it has gone so well for him that he bought another moto-cart, and he taught his wife to drive it, so that they could work together to transport people around the city. Now he works much more, since he has to provide constant maintenance for both moto-taxis. He hopes that he will be able to continue saving and to buy more moto-taxis. His dream is to start his own transportation company. On this occasion, he is requesting 500 soles to buy new tires and a canopy to improve his moto-taxi. In turn, he is committed to making his loan payments punctually and responsibly.

loans.use: to buy tires and a canopy for a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Resty’S Group

texts.en:
The female members of Resty’s group have all attended YICE trainings in farming-as-a-business. They belong to YICE’s female self-help group of Kyakatebe II village.  These women live in the same village, and because they have no money to pay for workers in their gardens, they offer group labor on a member’s garden in a revolving model. They all grow beans and maize, and they also rear pigs.

The leader of this group is Resty (first from left); she is 39 years old and married with four children. Resty has earned her income by growing maize and beans for the last 10 years, but she always yields less than expected.

She is applying for this loan to buy good quality seeds and fertilizers and to expand her maize and bean gardens. She intends to use her increased income from her yields to pay for school fees of her children and also establish a small retail shop in her village.

Resty has a dream of opening up a retail shop in her village so as to supplement her income.

loans.use: To buy good quality maize, bean seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Gertrude's Group

texts.en:
Gertrude (pictured first from right) is the featured borrower and leader of this group. She joined her other group members to apply for a loan because they are neighbors and friends, and they all belong to YICE’s female self-help group in Nkokooma village. All the group members are farmers who grow different crops for food and sale.

Getrude is a 27-year-old single mother of one, a child she had when in secondary school, which she had to leave before graduating. Since 2008, Gertrude has grown tomatoes and Irish potatoes to earn a living and care for her daughter. 

Gertrude and her group members were trained by YICE in better farming skills, and as a result they want to put into practice the skills they acquired. 

A small loan of $70 will enable Gertrude to buy good quality seeds and pay for laborers to clear her land for expansion.

Gertrude has a dream of educating her daughter up to University level.

loans.use: To buy good quality seeds and pay for casual laborers to clear fresh land for garden expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more food supplements and herbal medicines to resell.

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
