texts.en: Araceli is a married micro businesswoman with three minor children.  Her business is selling clothes and women's, men's and brides' shoes.  She's had the business for 15 years and she sells both for cash and on credit.  She will use the loan to buy synthetic shoes for women, shoes for men and shoes for brides.

loans.use: to buy synthetic shoes for women and shoes for men and brides.

loans.name: Nubia Auxiliadora

texts.es: Nubia es una microempresaria de éxito quien tiene cuatro años de tener su negocio el cual vende frutas y verduras frescas ambulante en los barrios de su comunidad, es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de frutas como papayas, melón, sandía, remolachas, y verduras como tomate, yuca, quequisques, plátano, etc.
texts.en: Nubia is a successful microentrepreneur. For the past four years she has owned her own business selling fresh fruits and vegetables. She males traveling sales in the neighborhoods of her community. She's a married woman and has four children. She will use the loan to purchase fruits such as papayas, melons, watermelons and beets, and vegetables such as tomatoes, yuccas, malangas, plantains, etc.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits such as papayas, melons, watermelons and beets, and vegetables such as tomatoes, yuccas, malangas, plantains, etc.

loans.name: Zafiro Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras de éxito una de ellas es Margarita hace seis años vende ropa, cosméticos variados de la Avon de manera ambulante y por encargo y al crédito, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa variada y cosméticos de la Avon como crema para cuerpos, crema para manos, perfumen de varón y de dama, lociones, etc. Francis vende ropa nueva también y Thelma vende frutas y verduras ambulantes.
texts.en: This group was formed by three successful ladies.  Margarita is one of them and she has been selling clothing and Avon cosmetics on foot for six years.  She takes orders and sells on credit.  She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and Avon cosmetics such as body creams, hand creams, ladies’ and men’s perfumes, lotions, etc.  Francis also sells new clothing and Thelma sells fruits and vegetables on foot.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Apocalipsis 3; 20 Group

texts.es: Este es un grupo formado por tres socios emprendedores una de ellas es María que vende queso y ropa usada en su domicilio desde hace 10 años. Es una viuda con 39 años de edad. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa nueva, y variada, queso también, Jenovis es otra socia su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon y Walter tiene un taller de calzado en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of three entrepreneurs.  Maria is one of them and she sells cheese and used clothing out of her home.  She’s done this for 10 years, is 39 years old and a widow.  She will use the money from this loan to buy a variety of new clothing and cheeses.  Jenovis is another partner and her business is selling Avon and Walter cosmetics.  She also has a shoe repair shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Eleuterio Jacinto

texts.es:
Eleuterio de 42 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, entre otros. Eleuterio es un hombre muy trabajador, desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar y ganarse el pan con el sudor de la frente ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y tuvo la necesidad de apoyarlos, es debido a ello que solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Eleuterio trabaja en su pequeño negocio de reparación de bicicletas, el trabaja desde muy temprano ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar, Eleuterio cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y también porque realiza buenos acabados.

Eleuterio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para su negocio como cámaras de llanta, pegamento, destornilladores nuevos, cuchillas, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá los materiales necesarios para realizar su trabajo y así poder luchar para hacer realidad  su más grande sueño:” Tener un nuevo local y mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Eleuterio is 42 years old and lives in the city of Camaná, which is characterized by having a warm and welcoming climate as well as by agricultural development, especially the cultivation of rice and beans, among others.    

Eleuterio is a very hard-working man.  From a very young age, he learned to work and earn his keep with the sweat of his brow because his parents had few economic resources and he needed to support them.  Due to that, he could only study up to the fifth grade of secondary education, but he would have liked to have a university degree.  

Day to day, Eleuterio works in his small bicycle repair business.  He works from very early in the morning because with the fruit of his labor he can cover his household expenses.  Eleuterio believes that he is getting ahead in his business because he is very friendly to his customers and also because he provides good results.  

Eleuterio is very grateful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy materials for his business such as inner tubes, glue, new screwdrivers, and knives, among other things.  In this way, he will have the materials necessary to perform his work and, thus, be able to fight to realize his biggest dream: to have a new location and a better home.

loans.use: to buy materials (inner tubes, glue, new screwdrivers, knives, etc.)

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer con un carisma contagiante, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad con un clima cálido, así como también playas hermosas y sobre todo con una gastronomía exquisita. Milagros es madre de 1 pequeño de 1 año de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y es el motor para que ella siga luchando cada día y sobre todo a quien le brinda todo su amor. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos milagros solo pudo estudiar hasta el segunda grado de educación primaria y por ello lucha para darle una buena educación a sus hijos y sean mejores que ella.

Día a día Milagros trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, ella ofrece sus productos a los vecinos de su barrio y también recorre las calles de la ciudad para ofrecer sus productos; ella cree que le va viene en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque tiene mucha fe en Dios.

Milagros está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio como labiales, cremas, sombras, rubores, entre otros; de esta manera tendrá una mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y poder mejorar sus ingresos, lo que le permitirá seguir en busca de hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio y darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Milagros is a woman with a contagious charisma.  She lives in the city of Pisco, a hot-climate city with beautiful beaches and above all exquisite cuisine.  Milagros is the mother of a one-year-old little one who she loves very much and is the motor for her to continue striving daily and providing all her love to.  Because of her poor economic resources, she was only able to study up to second grade in elementary school and this is why she strives to provide her children with a good education so they can be better than her.

Day to day, Milagros works in her small business selling cosmetics.  She offers her goods to neighbors and also covers the city streets to offer her goods.  She believes she does well in her business because she’s very kind to customers and above all because she has much faith in God.

Milagros is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given her she will be able to buy more merchandise like lipstick, creams, eye shadow, blush, etc. for her business.  In this way, she’ll have a wider variety of products to offer and will improve her income which will make it possible for her to make her greatest dream reality: to have a place of her own for her business and to provide her children with professions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a hardworking woman who lives in Hodeidah, Yemen.  She is 40 years old and is the mother of one adult child.  She loves her son and provides for him while he completes his studies.  

Safia is a teacher with a low salary.  She has lived in a rented house for many years.  She is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER to buy appliances for personal use.  She is tired of paying rent on a monthly basis and dreams of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy appliances for home use.

loans.name: Hussein Group

texts.en:
Hussein is a group of three women and a man from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for 120,000 YER to purchase livestock for keeping.

Sawsen, a 29-year-old uneducated married woman, is the leader of the group. She lives in the countryside. Most of the people in rural areas work in agriculture and livestock raising because most of them are illiterate. They have no other choice, and Sawsen is not an exception. 

Sawsen wants to raise sheep and goats, but she doesn’t have the capital. Therefore, she applied for a loan in the amount of 30,000 YER. She hopes to earn a good profit, open a savings account in the AMB, and buy a piece of land to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for keeping.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es: La señora Lizbeth nacida en la provincia de Quillacollo, municipio de Vinto, en el departamento de Cochabamba, trabaja desde muy pequeña, por otra parte la señora está casada con el señor Marco tienen dos hijos pequeños que asisten a la escuela fiscal de la zona, ellos viven a 80 kilómetros de la ciudad ella trabaja duro todos los días para ayudar a su padre y sacar adelante a su familia  la señora se dedica a la venta de comida hace 13 años, su esposo es chofer contratado, la señora solicita una ayuda para comprar sillas y mesas para su pequeño negocio de comidas así brindar una mejor atención a los clientes que van aumentando por la buena comida que elabora  y así de esta manera llegar a cumplir su sueño de abrir un restaurante algún día y darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Lizbeth was born in the province of Quillacollo, in the municipality of Vinto, in the department of Cochabama. She has worked since she was very young. She is married to Marco and they have 2 small children attending the public school in the area. They live 80 kilometers from the city. She works hard every day to help her father and to support her family. 

She has been working selling food for thirteen years. Her husband is a driver under contract. She is asking for help to buy chairs and tables for her small food business in order to offer better service to her customers that are increasing because of the good food she prepares and this is the way to fulfill her dream of opening a restaurant some day and giving her children a better future.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her small food business so she can provide better service

loans.name: Al-Fadhila Group

texts.en:
Al-Fadhila is a group of three women and a man from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 120,000 YER to pay for construction supplies.

Baseima is a 25-year-old, illiterate married woman with two children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented house. They bought a small piece of land to build their own house. She needs money to pay for construction supplies, so she applied for a loan in the amount of 30,000 YER. She hopes, after completing the building of her house, to start thinking of a small business to help her husband in improving their family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for construction supplies.

loans.name: Amer Group

texts.en:
The Amer Group consists of four ladies from Hodeidah, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 90,000 Yemeni rials (YER) and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment. 

Aisha is a 46-year-old mother of nine children. Most of them are in school. She has been selling ladies clothes and perfumes. The income from this business was not enough to cover her children's school fees and other important household expenses and made her unable to dedicate enough time to her kids. It is an effort to assist her husband. So, she is asking for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to start up a business. She will use this loan to buy more perfumes and incense for resale. Her dream is to one day diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes and incense for resale.

loans.name: Aqeel

texts.en: Aqeel is 35 years old and lives in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who works a bus driver. He is the breadwinner of his family and gets  a low profit. He was able to repay the cost of purchasing the bus from his friend. He would like to improve his living standards so he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER to buy spare parts for his bus. He would like to continue increasing his daily profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Kram Group

texts.en: Kram group is located in Hodeidah,Yemen. The group is made up of four ladies. Najwa, 35, is a mother of five children. She works very hard at selling various products, such as cosmetic materials, incense and clothing, by going from door to door. She managed to save up a small amount of money, which got her job started. Due to the meager profit she is making out of it, she is forced to apply for a loan to buy various products, such as cosmetic materials, incense and clothing to keep her job running and to cover the demands of the season.

loans.use: to buy various products, such as cosmetic materials, incense and clothing, for resale

loans.name: Najib

texts.en: Najib, 43 years old, is married and has 4 children who live in Taiz, Yemen. He has had a small house for many years. Najib would like to improve his living standards but harsh conditions impede the march of his life. He would like to apply for loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.name: Yolanda Irene

texts.es: La señora Yolanda  y su esposo vive en una zona alejada de la ciudad a 25 minutos de la misma  ellos no tiene dependientes por que sus hijos son mayores, el esposo esta muy delicado de salud por ser de la tercera edad, la señora se dedica al expendio de comidas en un mercado de la ciudad en la feria de barrio lindo, y sirve desayunos los sábados ella se levanta desde las 5 de la mañana y va a su puestos para vender sus desayunos ellos son de escasos recursos no cuentan con casa propia  y los tratamientos de su esposo son caros ya que la señora no cuenta con seguro de asistencia social con el presente crédito se pretende mejorar sus ingresos, y así mejorar su calidad de vida y así mejorara las condiciones de salud del esposo enfermo que esta en tratamiento.
texts.en:
Yolanda and her husband live in an area about 25 minutes outside the city. They do not have any dependents because their children are grown up. Her husband is not in very good health because of his old age. Yolanda works at a food stall in the city market and serves breakfasts on Saturdays. She wakes up at 5 a.m. and goes to her stall to sell her breakfasts. 
They have a low income and do not have their own house. Furthermore, the medical treatment for her husband is expensive because they do not have health insurance. With the loan she is requesting, Yolanda hopes to increase her income and improve her quality of life so that her sick husband who is receiving treatment gets better.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and a stove for her business.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: El señor Dionicio tiene 48 años, es uriondo de Potosí estudio hasta segundo básico los escasos recursos de sus padres no le ayudaron a continuar sus estudios después de un año su madre falleció por una fuerte enfermedad y cuando el tenía 8 años empezó a trabajar de manera independiente para poder solventar gastos familiares porque él es el hijo mayor. Actualmente es casado con doña Macaria fruto del matrimonio tiene 5 hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación junto a su pareja, viven a 25 kilómetros de la población de Ivirgarzama en  sindicato San Benito - Tamborada cuentan con una pequeña parcela donde tienen cultivado 1 ha. de piña y comercializan en el mercado local, ahora don Dionicio quiere ampliar su cultivo es por tal razón que solicita un crédito, esto le ayudara a genera mayores ingresos económicos y paralelamente su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 48 years old and come from Potosí. He only studied until  second grade of  elementary school,  because his parents could not afford to support him to continue his studies. A year later, his mother passed away due to a serious illness, and when he was eight years old, he began working independently to be able to pay the family’s expenses because he is the eldest son. 

He is now married to Macaria and they have five children, whom they both help and support in their schooling. They live 25 km from the town of Ivirgarzama in the San Benito-Tamborada community. They have a small plot of land that they use to grow pineapples which they sell at the local market. Now Dionicio wants to expand his crops, and this is why he is requesting a loan. The loan will help him to generate more income and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies to grow pineapples.

loans.name: Sona's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three kids who are students residing in Battambang province (Cambodia), Sona is 36 years old and a local farmer who grows rice and sesame as her main sources of income. She has been involved in her business for five years.

 Sona is leading this fourth-time borrowers group consisting of two female members including her, to apply for a new loan. The past loan that she has fully paid back has helped to keep up a good pace of her lifestyle to cover her daily consumption.  Now, the total loan amount of her group is 8,000,000 KHR. 

Sona, whose loan portion is 4,000,000 KHR, will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her cash-crops. She hopes to increase her income so that she can keep all of her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her cash-crops

loans.name: Sreytey's Group

texts.en:
A 30-year-old single woman originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sreytey is a farmer who grows cassava on four hectares of farmland in order to cover her daily basic needs. She has been engaged in this business for five years and is able to earn up to 23,300 KHR per day. 

This is the fourth loan for Sreytey with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that she has completely paid back has better supported her business in a timely manner and returned her a decent income to maintain her lifestyle. Now, in this group of two, she is the leader. The women are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. Sreytey will use her portion to hire laborers to reap her cassava. She hopes to collect her yield on time and sell it with a good price for a higher income.

loans.use: To pay for reaping her crops

loans.name: Soeurn's Group

texts.en:
Soeurn, 28, is a young mother of two school children and one little kid residing in Battambang province (Cambodia). She covers the daily food expenses in her household through rice farming and sesame planting.  She is able to earn up to 12,700 KHR per day from the current business that she has been with for five years. 

Now, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan with VisionFund. She feels confident to sustain her living in a proper standard after the successful past loan that she has fully repaid. In this cycle, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each. Soeurn is going to spend her portion to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to gain a high yield from her sesame plants, better than last year, and make more income for her children’s sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for labor cost

loans.name: Alex Diego

texts.es: El señor Alex tiene 28 años proviene de una familia humilde y responsable, actualmente está viviendo con sus padres y hermanos,  desde que era un niño empezó a trabajar ayudando a su padre en el negocio de la mecánica,  no dejando a un lado los estudios, en el transcurro del tiempo al señor Alex le gusto la actividad que realiza su padre. Con el esfuerzo y voluntad logro alcanzar el nivel de instrucción de  técnico en mecánica, para su corta edad cuenta con varios años de experiencia y amplios conocimientos en el desarrollo de su actividad. Donde logro ganarse el respeto y aprecio de la clientela, Las herramientas y equipo con las que trabaja fueron comprados hace varios años o fueron otorgadas por el padre. El señor Alex viendo esta necesidad de la renovación  de sus herramientas y  maquinaria de trabajo, solicito el crédito cuyo destino será  para la compra de herramientas y equipos.
texts.en:
Señor Alex is 28 years old, and comes from a humble and responsible family. He currently lives with his parents and siblings. 

Since he was a boy he worked helping his father in his mechanics business, while not neglecting his studies. Over time, Alex began to enjoy the job his father did. With effort and willpower he managed to reach mechanic level. Despite his young age he has many years of experience and broad knowledge in developing in his profession, in which he has gained the respect and appreciation of his customers. 

The tools and equipment he works with were bought many years ago and were given to him by his father. Señor Alex, noticing the need to renew his tools and work machines, requested the loan, which he will use to buy tools and equipment.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Sieb's Group

texts.en:
Sieb is 52 years old and a married father blessed with one kid who is still in school. The rest of his family resides in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. Sieb works with his wife to grow rice and beans to provide the main source of the family's income. He has been a farmer for 10 years and earns about 27,500 KHR per day. He has repaid three previous loans that have gradually improved his lifestyle.

Sieb is the leader of a two-person group requesting a 1,400,000 KHR loan for each member. He will use his loan portion to buy potash and insecticide for three hectares of farmland as well as pay for labor fees. Sieb hopes to grow his crop fruitfully and timely to increase his yields and earn larger profits for his children’s sake.

loans.use: to buy potash and insecticide as well as pay labor fees

loans.name: Sambor's Group

texts.en:
Sambor lives in a rural village of the Kror Kor District of Pursat Province, Cambodia. Sambor is 26 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer on one hectare of farmland for more than five years. Her husband makes palm juice to generate more income. Her current business earns about 10,000 riels (KHR) per day and she can afford to save 5,000 KHR each day after expenses.

Sambor’s group consists of two members who live in the same village. Sambor is in her first cycle with VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan. Sambor will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Don Mario, tiene 34 años de edad, su familia está compuesta tiene dos hijos, es una familia humilde de escasos recursos económicos, viven en la comunidad de Quebradas del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba. Trabaja en la agricultura y la pecuaria, produce papa, frejol y cebolla; los comercializa en el mismo lugar donde vive a los comerciantes de la misma población de Mizque. Don Mario es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de la alimentación y la educación de su familia. Tienen una vivienda de paredes de adobe, techo de cañahueca, teja y revoque de barro, esta clase de vivienda cada año antes de las lluvias hay que hacer el revoque, Don Mario, está solicitando el presente crédito para comprar más semillas, abonos y agroquímicos para tener una buena producción y de esta manera y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Mario is 34 years old. He has two children. His is a family of scarce financial resources. They live in the village of Quebrada of the municipality of Mizque, in the department of Cochabamba. He works in agriculture and raises animals. He grows potatoes, beans and onions; he sells them in the same village where he lives, to sellers of that same village of Mizque. Mario is a very well-respected person in his community because of his dedication to his work and also because he's responsible for providing food and education for his family. They live in a house with adobe walls and a roof made of bamboo, tiles and mud plaster. This type of house has to be re-plastered every year before the rainy season. Mario is requesting the loan in order to purchase more seeds, compost and agrochemicals. That way he'll achieve a good level of production and therefore he'll improve his entire family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.es: La señora Jannette se dedica a la actividad  de compra y venta de motos usadas , lo cual lo hace bastante tiempo y adquiriendo una experiencia para poder desarrollar y llevar bien su negocio , pero ella tuvo que pasar muchas  circunstancias  para poder establecerse en la actividad económica que desarrolla, y  así poder lograr una buena economía , por que su familia es de escasos recursos y no habiendo muchas oportunidades laborales es que ella se dedica desde muy joven a trabajar  para poder ayudar a sustentar a su familia económicamente  pero  con el pensamiento de seguir adelante y superarse cada día mas , se dedico al comercio para superarse en la vida y tener una vida mucho mejor sin tener que pasar necesidades , es que en ese sentido solicita el préstamo para poder ampliar mas su actividad económica y así poder comprar más motos para la venta.
texts.en:
Jannette works buying and selling used motorcycles. She has been doing this for quite a while and has acquired experience in order to develop her business and it is successful. But she had to go through many circumstances in order to be able to establish herself in the economic activity she works in and thus to be able to achieve good holdings. Because her family had scarce resources and because of not having many job opportunities she has worked since she was very young in order to be able to help and support her family financially.

But with the thought of advancing and getting ahead more each day, she started a business to improve her life and to have a better life without having to do without necessities and this is why she is asking for a loan in order to be able to expand her work activity and thus be able to buy more motorcycles for resale.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business of buying and selling motorcycles

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: La  joven Delia tiene 19 años de edad estado civil soltera actualmente vive conjuntamente con sus padres, pero económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la actividad agrícola en terreno de 2 Has que es herencia de sus padres produce papa, locoto con rotación de cultivos tiene experiencia en el rubro la comunidad de Corani Pampa Duraznos que se encuentra a 82 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba Delia necesita un crédito para comprar ganado vacuno lechero ella nos dice para ella es más fácil cuidar ganado vacuno lechero y vender queso, leche porque la agricultura necesita jornales y manejar las cargas para una mujer es más dificultoso. Delia está contenta de poder adquirir el préstamo porque comprara el ganado vacuno lechero y así seguirá ahorrando para construir su propia vivienda y a formar una familia a futuro.
texts.en: Young Delia is 19 years old and single. She currently lives with her parents, but she's financially independent. She works in farming on a 2-hectare plot of land which she inherited from her parents. She grows potatoes and locoto (a type of pepper) on a crop rotation system. She is experienced in her line of work within the community of Corani Pampa Duraznos, which is located 82 kilometers from the town of Cochabamba. Delia needs a loan in order to purchase dairy cattle. She reports that it's easier for her to raise dairy cattle and sell milk and cheese, because agriculture requires day laborers, and it's harder for a woman to handle the heavy loads. Delia is glad to obtain the loan, because she'll purchase the dairy cattle and therefore she'll keep on saving money in order to build her own house and start a family someday.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Mach's Group

texts.en:
Mach, 41, lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Kro Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. All of her children are dependent on her and three of them are in school while the others are still small. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on one-hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for 15 years while her husband makes palm juice. Together, they can earn about 10,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 4,000 KHR each day for the future.

Mach’s group consists of two members who are just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cultivated land

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Sreymom, 35 years old, is married and resides with her family in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district in Cambodia. Sreymom has a daughter and a son, both still dependent on her and currently in school. Sreymom and her husband offer a decent life for the family through agriculture, farming rice on a two-hectare plot of farm. To earn additional income for the family, Sreymom also sells grocery products and her husband works as a teacher.

This is Sreymom’s first time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking a KHR 2,000,000 loan to buy fertilizer and to plow her farmland. This industrious woman hopes to earn as much income as possible from the rice-growing business which provides the main source of the family’s income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dim's Group

texts.en:
Dim, 35 years old, is married and blessed with five children, three of whom still need his support as they are in school. Dim and his wife farm rice as the family's primary source of income. To supplement their income, Dim drives motor-taxi and his wife sells sugarcane juice. Dim has been involved in his business for 7 years.

Dim has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles and has fully repaid his loan, which supported his business and progressively upgraded his lifestyle. Dim is now in need of capital to better support his wife’s business selling sugarcane juice. He therefore formed a group of four members in order to apply for a new loan. Dim is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR while his co-borrowers are each seeking 1,000,000 KHR. Dim will use his loan portion to buy a machine that squeezes sugarcane into juice. He hopes to make more income and sustain his living.

loans.use: to buy a machine that squeezes sugarcane into juice

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 56 years old and one of the breadwinners in a family with three children, one of whom is still at home and attending school. She is originally  from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Sok struggles to provide for her family and is a rice farmer who also grows beans. She has been a farmer for 13 years and earns about 23,300 KHR per day. This will be the second loan for Sok's group. Her previous loan helped her to gradually improve her business and also her lifestyle. 

Sok is the leader of a two-person loan group that is requesting a 1,200,000 KHR loan for each member. She will use her loan portion to pay harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide for her farm. Sok hopes to harvest her crop in a timely manner and triple her income from last year.

loans.use: to pay harvesting fees and buy fertilizer, seed, and insecticide

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Reom is the mother of three children, only one of whom is in school. She is 43 years old and a rural villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, she grows rice on one hectare of farmland and also supplements the family’s income through selling groceries. She has engaged in this for 10 years and it has enabled her to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second loan for Reom with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She used her first loan to successfully stabilize her business as well as her living conditions. Now in a group of two, she is the leader in order to apply for a new loan. She is going to spend her portion to buy potash, seed, and insecticide for her bean farm. Moreover, she will use some portion of her loan to buy additional grocery items such as canned food, instant noodles, spices etc. for resale. She hopes to double her income and sustain her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for resale

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Heng is 39 years old.  She is the mother of four children.  She financially supports two of her daughters who are still in school.   

Heng is one of the breadwinners for her family.  She manages two hectares of rice-growing farmland and two hectares of bean-growing farmland. 
She has engaged in this business for 10 years and is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day.

This is Heng's fourth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  Past loans have been fully repaid.  Now Heng is applying for a loan with a fellow group member.  She is requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR for the new cycle.  Heng is going to use the funds to pay a rice reaping fee as well as to purchase fertilizer and insecticide.  She hopes that she can collect her yield on time and make more income to pay for her children’s education.  Her fellow group member is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR.

loans.use: to pay a reaping fee and buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Sokhang's Group

texts.en: Sokhang, 36, lives in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district in Cambodia’s Pursat province. She is married and has three children, all of whom are still dependent on her and too young for schooling. A two-hectare farmland provides the source of her family’s income. Having been working as a rice farmer for more than fifteen years, Sokhang earns around 25,000 KHR daily and saves about 15,000 KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. Sokhang has been with VisionFund for two loans already, with which she succeeded in supporting her rice-growing business. She is now leading a group of three female members to take out a loan with VisionFund in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a group representative, Sokhang will spend her loan portion on purchasing six sacks of fertilizer to help keep the rice field in good shape. She will also utilize the loan portion to buy chickens and ducks to raise in order to generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To purchase six sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 49 years old and mother of five children, two of whom are schoolchildren. She lives in Battambang province, Cambodia. Sopheap is a local rice farmer who cultivates five hectares of rice and a half-hectare of sesame. She and her husband are able to earn up to 23,300 KHR per day. Sopheap has been a farmer for 15 years and has borrowed from the Kiva partner VisionFund four times. She has successfully repaid her previous loans and feels confident about progressively improving her lifestyle. 

Sopheap is the leader of a three-woman loan group requesting a 1,400,000 KHR loan for each. Sopheap will use her portion to pay a harvesting collection fee and buy fertilizer and seed for her farm. She hopes to harvest her cash crop on time and sell it at a high price to better support her family and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to pay harvesting fees and buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Kheom's Group

texts.en:
Kheom is 33 years old and the mother of four schoolchildren and one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. She lives in Battambang Province’s Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common business for villagers like her. In addition to paddy rice, she also grows corn to meet the daily food consumption needs of her household. 

Kheom has been farming for 5 years and this will be her first loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She is the leader of a group consisting of two female members who are applying for loans in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR each.  Kheom will use her portion to pay for corn reaping fees. She hopes to harvest as much corn as possible so that she can replant her field seasonably.

loans.use: To pay for corn reaping fees

loans.name: Lis' Group

texts.en: Lis is 34 years of age and married. She lives in a rural village of the Srey Snom district, located in Siem Reap province in Cambodia. She is blessed with four sons, all of whom are school-aged children. Lis makes her living by farming rice on a hectare of farmland. Each day, she earns around 10,000 KHR and manages to save approximately 5,000 KHR after accounting for the family's daily living costs. Lis is leading a loan group of three female members who all are first-time borrowers with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. They are each applying for loans in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. Lis will spend her portion of the group loan to construct a comfortable house that will provide an appropriate environment in which her family can live, especially her young kids.

loans.use: To construct a house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Rum's Group

texts.en:
Rum, 52 and a diligent farmer residing in Battambang province of Cambodia, is also a mother of seven children. Currently, she is responsible only for three children as they are still students in local public school in the area.  On two hectare each of farmland, she grows paddy rice and sesame in order to support her family; it is the business that she has been with for 10 years.  

Two cycles ago was her original loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely paid back her entire loan and it has empowered her to upgrade her lifestyle and be in better shape. Now, she has formed a group of five members including her. The total requested loan amount is 5,300,000 KHR. Rum whose loan portion is 500,000 KHR will use her loan to pay for labor fees, seed and insecticide. She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her crops on time and return her double profit.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees, seed and insecticide

loans.name: Aminas

texts.en: A 45-year-old married woman named Aminas lives in the Sampov Meas District in Cambodia’s Pursat Province. She has four children including two sons who are still dependent on her. Aminas makes a living by farming rice, earning approximately 41,000 riels (KHR) daily. This is Aminas’ first time requesting a loan from Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is seeking a 2,600,000 KHR loan to purchase a head of buffalo. Besides farming, Aminas dreams of having a small stall selling grocery products in a local market.

loans.use: To purchase a head of buffalo

loans.name: Vuon's Group

texts.en:
Vuon is 28 years old and married with one child. She lives with her family in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For the past five years, Vuon has worked as a rice and sesame farmer and is able to earn up to 23,600 KHR per day. She has repaid a previous loan with the Kiva partner VisionFund and keeps gradually improving her living standards. 

Vuon is the leader of a three-woman group requesting a 3,400,000 KHR loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy seed and potash, and to pay plowing fees for the upcoming planting season. Vuon hopes to harvest her crop in a timely manner and earn a good yield and income so that she can set aside some money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy seed and potash and pay plowing fees

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en:
Sok is 62 years old and is a widow with seven children. She is a citizen living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district in Cambodia’s Battambang province. Sok is a hardworking single mother who offers a decent life for her family by farming rice and  planting watermelon and cucumber. She is able to earn approximately 48,000KHR daily and she saves 10,000 KHR after offsetting her daily living costs. Sok has received six previous loans through the Kiva partner VisionFund that  have enabled her to gradually improve her family’s living standards. 

Sok is the leader of a three-woman loan group requesting a 3,400,000 KHR loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her watermelon and cucumber planting business. Sok hopes to smartly use her loan to continue to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for her watermelon and cucumber planting business

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Khun is 28 years old and single. She has been in rice farming, watermelon and bean growing for 8 years to make a living. Sometimes, she also catches fish to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day and she manages to save 10,000KHR each day after daily expenses.

Khun has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles. She has completely paid back the loans which have helped her better support her family and her current business. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan 1,200,000KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her plantation and to buy fishing materials. Khun hopes that this loan will enable her to extend her current business so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy seeds for her plantation

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn, 52, is a rural villager in Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Phorn is the breadwinner for his family of six children. Currently, he needs to support only one son who is still in school. He does rice farming as his main business plus fishing for resale and working for others for a fee to supplement his income. From his business, he is able to earn up to 25,000 KHR per day. Phorn is not a new borrower as he has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three previous loans already. He has fully paid back his last loan and it has enabled him to provide decent daily food for his children. He is applying for a fourth loan in amount of 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy a decent motorbike to support his routine job as a construction paid worker and also support his business. He hopes that this purchase will help him to save his travel time so as he can use his time to look after his child. Moreover, he is able to ship his crop to the market for selling.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to support his business and for commuting.

loans.name: Choeurn

texts.en: Choeurn, 45, is local farmer who needs to provide for the two of her four children who are still in school. She has been farming for 3 years on two hectares of rice-cropping farmland to earn a living. To generate additional income for the family, she also works for others for a fee while her husband also catches fish for resale after helping on the rice farm. Now, she is in ther fifth cycle loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. After the successful loans that she has completely repaid, she is able to live in an much improved standard of living. Now, she is in need of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to purchase potash, rice seed, and to pay for a plowing fee and a farmland leasing fee. Moreover, she will also use a portion of the loan to fix her house. She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her rice fruitfully and to provide her with a good crop yield so that she can keep a good living standard for her family and keep her children in school until the tertiary level.

loans.use: To purchase potash, rice seed, and to pay for a plowing fee

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Ran is a villager living in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district in Cambodia. She is a 47-year-old married woman with six children. Ran and her husband provide a decent life for their family by farming rice and earning around 14,000 KHR per day and saving approximately 9,000 KHR after meeting their daily expenses. Ran is now seeking for a 3,500,000 KHR loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the first time. She plans to utilize her requested loan to purchase fertilizer and a cow to support her rice-growing business. Ran hopes to improve the family’s living standards through the income generated from the rice-growing business after receiving and using the loan as she plans.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a cow

loans.name: Pouy's Group

texts.en:
Pouy, 61, is a widowed mother of five children living in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. Pouy has struggled to make a daily living by growing rice as her primary source of income. She also gets paid to wrap hashed meat with a banana leaf.  

Pouy is a fourth-time borrower with VisionFund. Her past loan is completely repaid already, and has supported her business better than before the loan. It provided her with a good income to purchase daily food for her children. For the current loan, the total amount for her group is 3,400,000 KHR with Pouy’s portion being 1,000,000 KHR. She will use her loan to pay a harvesting and plowing fee. Also, she will buy seed and fertilizer for her rice crop. She hopes to increase her income and use it for her family, especially for her children’s education.

loans.use: To pay the harvesting and plowing fee for her rice-growing business.

loans.name: Sok Rith's Group

texts.en:
Sok Rith, 26 years old, lives in a rural village in the Kror Kor district of Cambodia’s Pursat province. She is married and the mother of two dependent children, one of whom is a student. To earn a living, Sok Rith farms rice and raises cows and buffaloes. To supplement the family's income, Sok Rith’s husband works for others as a paid worker. Sok Rith and her husband earn around 11,000 KHR per day, of which they save approximately 5,000 KHR after offsetting their daily expenses.

Sok Rith has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four loan cycles, through which she secured food needs for her family. She is now leading a loan group of three female members to take out a new loan of 2,600,000K HR in total. Sok Rith will spend her loan portion on buying one more head of buffalo. This industrious woman expects a boost in her income.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Hoeurt's Group

texts.en:
Hoeurt, age 32, is a married mother of two schoolchildren. She is a local villager in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. To meet the family's basic daily needs, she sells grocery items while her husband works for others for a fee. She has been engaged in this business for 8 years. 

Hoeurt has been with VisionFund for six cycles, and she has completely paid back her previous loans. The loans have provided her with a good income to sustain her business. Hoeurt is now a member of a two-person group applying for a new loan. Each of them is seeking 1,400,000 KHR. Hoeurt is going to spend her portion of the group loan on purchasing more grocery items for resale. She hopes to replenish her inventory and double her income so she can keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Channra's Group

texts.en:
Channra is 27 years old and has two children who are in school. She is a citizen from the Ek Phnom District of Battambang province. Along with her husband, Channra grows rice and watermelons. Her husband also works as a fisherman. Channra has been a farmer for 18 years and has repaid three previous loans. Her loans have allowed her to improve her living conditions. 

Channra is a member of a two-woman loan group. She is requesting 1,400,000 KHR through the Kiva partner VisionFund to buy watermelon seed and fertilizer and her co-borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. Channra hopes to harvest her watermelon on time and get a double yield to earn more income for her family. She plans to provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Mano Group

texts.en: Mano Group is a group that is composed of four women. They are from Hodiedah, Yemen. They work together to help one another. They are hardworking, enterprising women who do not give up easily. They are currently requesting for a loan of 60,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to expand their business levels. Suad is the leader of the group. She is 31 years old and lives in Hodiedah. She started her business of selling incense and perfumes when her husband could no longer afford their household expenses. Her business has helped her to provide for her family. She is turning to AMB to request for a loan of 15,000 YER to buy incense and perfumes because she has pending orders and would like to be able to fill them for her customers.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to resell.

loans.name: Ekram Group

texts.en:
Ekram is a group of six ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. 

Group member Samira is a 30-year-old mother of three children. She started her work three years ago as a door-to-door clothing seller, right after her husband's death. She has applied for a loan in order to buy clothes for the winter season. This extra profit will help to start her up for the next season, which in turn will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the winter season.

loans.name: Khom's Group

texts.en:
Khom, age 57, is a rice and soybean farmer. She has been engaged in this work for the past 10 years and earns 27,000 KHR per day. She grows rice on five hectares of land and soybeans on another five hectares. She and her husband have two children.

She is in now in her fifth cycle loan with VisionFund, a Kiva partner. She managed her past loan funds intelligently in a manner that allowed her to sustain her business and improve her family's living conditions. She has successfully repaid her previous loans. For this cycle, she is the leader of a group of two female members. 

Khom intends to use her portion of the loan to buy potash and seeds and to pay the plowing fee for her crop husbandry. This will help her grow and harvest her crops on time. This investment will allow her to earn more income. Her goal is to set aside enough money to buy additional farmland in order to expand the scale of her farming venture.

loans.use: to buy potash and seeds and to pay the plowing fee for her crop husbandry

loans.name: Senghak's Group

texts.en:
Senghak, 34 years of age, is a villager who resides in a rural area of the Bakan district in Cambodia’s Pursat province. She is married and has three dependent sons, two of whom are students. Senghak and her husband offer a decent life for the family by farming rice on a five-hectare plot of land. Together, they are able to earn around 17,000 KHR, of which they save approximately 7,000 KHR after expenses.

Senghak is now leading a group of two female members, both first-time borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), to apply for a loan of 500,000 KHR each. Senghak will spend her loan portion on purchasing fertilizer to apply to her farmland. This hardworking mother hopes to earn as much income as possible from the rice-growing business so that she can send all of her children to school and advance their education as far as possible.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Josue Manuel

texts.es: El cliente es el joven Josué Manuel, tiene 29 años, culmino con sus estudios en el colegio, pero no pudo ingresar a la universidad por falta de recursos económicos por parte de sus padres y por falta de orientación, ya que tuvo una mala influencia de sus amigos. Empezó a trabajar como ayudante de albañil ya que no tenía experiencia en ningún rubro, posteriormente aprendió a conducir y saco su licencia de conducir para trabajar como chofer del vehículo de su tío al cual actualmente se dedica, paralelo a su actividad trabaja de chapero junto a su tío, donde trabajan por la tarde ya que por la mañana el tío trabaja como promotor de eventos. El cliente actualmente  vive en alquiler  en la zona de Pacata Alta - Cochabamba- Bolivia, es soltero y no tiene hijos. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una compresora para la chapería, ya que en un futuro piensa dedicarse solamente a esa actividad.
texts.en: Josué Manuel is 29 years old and finished high school but he was not able to get into university due to lack of financial resources and orientation, since he had bad influence from his friends.  He began working as a mason’s assistant because he didn’t have experience in any trade.  He later learned to drive and got his license to work as a driver and drives for his uncle.  At the same time he does auto repair work with his uncle in the evenings and promotes events in the mornings.  He currently lives in a rented home in the Pacata Alta - Cochabamba- Bolivia zone.  He’s single and has no children.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a compressor to do auto repair work, since he plans to focus on that in the future.

loans.use: to buy a compressor.

loans.name: Al-Bra Group

texts.en: The Al-Bra Group includes three women who live in Hodeida, Yemen. Sada is a 35-year-old mother of seven children. She has been selling clothing, perfumes and incense for five years. Sada is trying to improve her family's quality of life after her husband divorced her financially. She started to sell pieces of her own gold to start up her business. She has applied for a loan to buy more perfumes, clothing and incense.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, clothing and incense.

loans.name: Filomen

texts.es: EL SEÑOR FILOMEN TIENE SU SEÑORA  PERO NO SON CASADOS Y TIENEN  TRES HIJOS.                                       DESDE HACE AÑOS, RADICAN EN EL TROPICO DE COCHABAMBA, EN SINDICATO INIDAS DE MUNICIPIO DE ENTRE RIOS, DESDE 12 AÑOS. EL SEÑOR FILOMEN ES DE LA PROVINCIA SAN JOSE ZUDAÑEZ CHUQUISACA, UNO DE LOS LUGARES MAS POBRES DE BOLIVIA, VINO DE SU COMUNIDAD DE SAN JOSE, COMO LA MAYORIA DE LAS PERSONAS BUSCANDO MAYOR OPORTUNIDAD DE VIDA, EN SU COMUNIDAD LA PRODUCCION BAJO DEBIDO A LOS CAMBIOS CLIMATOLOGICOS, DIFICIL DE CONTROLAR, CADA VEZ LA PRODUCCION ESCASEO, POR LO QUE DECIDIO IR AL TROPICO, PERO CON EL TRASCURSO DEL TIEMPO, CON MUCHO TRABAJO Y ESFUERZO SE COMPRO SU LOTE AGRICOLA, EN LA QUE HOY EN DIA TRABAJA EN EL SECTOR AGRICOLA Y SE DEDICA A LA PRODUCCION DE CITRICO (MANDARINA). EL CREDITO QUE ESTA SOLICITANDO ES PARA CONSTRUCION DE VIVIENDA,  DE ESTA MANERA PODRA MEJORAR SU NIVEL DE VIDA TAMBIEN SU SEÑORA SIEMPRE HA ESTA COLABORANDO EN SUS ACTIVIDADES.
texts.en: Filomen is in a common law marriage and has three children.  They have lived within Cochabamba tropics for years; for 12 years in the town of Entre Rios.  Filomen is originally from the San Jose Zudañez Chuquisaca province, one of the poorest areas of Bolivia.  He came from the community of San Jose, like most people, to look for a way to earn a living.  Production is low in his community because of the climate change and each time the production decreases.  He decided to move to the tropical area and bought a plot of farmland with great effort and sacrifice.  Now he raises citrus (mandarin oranges).  He will use the money from this loan to build a house.  This way he will be able to improve his quality of life.  His wife has always been helpful.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Ahbab Al-Mustafa Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ahbab Al-Mustafa. It consists of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Together, they have requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 YER. 

One member of the group is Fathia. She is 37 years old and has two children. She sells incense and perfumes to earn a living, and she has been operating her business for five years. She pushes herself to work hard in order to provide for her children's needs. She has applied for a loan in the amount of 40,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy incense and perfumes to offer for sale. This loan will improve her business income and help improve her family's living standards. She hopes eventually to own a store where she can sell incense, perfumes, and cosmetic materials.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to offer for sale.

loans.name: Alaseel Group

texts.en:
Alaseel group has four members who live in Hodeida, Yemen. 

Gboola is 28 years old. She works as a door-to-door saleswoman, selling clothes and sweets. She is hardworking and responsible for her family. 

Gboola would like to expand her business, but she doesn`t have sufficient money. She has applied for a loan to buy different types of sweets and clothes. She hopes to improve her living standards and expand her business to sell more products and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy different types of sweets and clothes.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es: La señora Dayana y su esposo provienen  de familias humildes y responsables, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de su padre, quien viendo el cariño y unión de su hija Dayana y su esposo otorgo un lugar donde pudieran vivir en familia. Son una pareja joven de veintiún años y veintidós años con sueños de un futuro próspero y otorgarle todas las oportunidades que ellos no tuvieron, a su pequeño hijo  de ocho meses, quien es el impulsor y el motivo que esta joven pareja tiene para  salir hacia adelante, buscando mejores oportunidades para su familia. Su esposo trabaja de operador en una empresa de construcción hace diez meses y la señora Dayana tiene una tienda de barrio que está ubicado en la casa de su padre, la necesidad por la cual busca el crédito es incrementar y variar  su mercadería de su tienda y así tener más ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Dayana and her husband come from humble and responsible families.  They currently live with her father, who after seeing the love and union of Danyana and her husband, provided them a place where they could live as a family.  They are a young couple, ages 21 and 22, with dreams for a prosperous future and they want to provide their eight month old son, who is their motivation for getting ahead, with all of the opportunities they didn’t have.  They are always looking for better opportunities for their family.

Her husband has been working at a construction company for eight months and Dayana has a neighborhood store in her father’s house.  She needs this loan to increase her inventory of merchandise so she can increase her family income.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Al-Khir Group

texts.en: The Al-Khir group is made up of four women who have applied for a loan of 110,000 YER. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. One year ago, the 26-year-old Amima began her business by selling perfumes, incense and clothes door-to-door. She has applied for a loan to buy more perfumes, incense and clothes to expand her business. She hopes to earn a good income, which will allow her to improve her own and her family's quality of life. She is hoping to renovate her house with the extra profit.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and clothes to help expand her business.

loans.name: Zonia Esther

texts.es:
Zonia es una mujer de 53 años de edad. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, en la cual se encuentran playas hermosas y sobre todo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, frejoles, pallares, entre otros. Desde joven Zonia tuvo la necesidad de trabajar ya que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos y debido a ello solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder estudiar la carrera de diseño de moda. Zonia es madre de 3 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y por quienes trabaja y se esfuerza para poder sacarlos adelante y poder brindarle mejores oportunidades que las que tuvo ella.

Día a día Zonia trabaja en su pequeño negocio de compostura y confección de prendas de vestir, ella le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; ella cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque realiza un buen trabajo.

Zonia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo podrá comprar materiales para poder hacer su trabajo como telas de seda, cierres, tubos, hilos, elásticos, entre otros; de esta manera podrá tener los materiales necesarios para su negocio y podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando cada día para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio y poder darle una buena educación a sus hijos”
texts.en:
Zonia is a 53-year old woman. She lives in the town of Pisco where you can find beautiful beaches and, most importantly, agriculture. Farmers there grow cotton, beans, Lima beans etc. Ever since she was a young woman Zonia has had to work since her parents were poor. As a result she only went to grade 5 of secondary school, but she would have liked to study fashion design.

Zonia has three children whom she loves very much. She works hard so they can get ahead, and she makes a great effort to provide them with better opportunities than she had.

She works daily in her small sewing business where she makes clothing. She spends about ten hours a day at work and can see up to twenty clients daily. She believes her business is going well because she is very friendly to her customers and above because she does good work.

Zonia is very grateful to Kiva donors as it is thanks to their great support that she will be able to buy sewing supplies such as silk fabric, zippers, tubing, thread, elastic etc. Then she will have on hand all the items necessary for her business and will be able to increase earnings. She will continue working hard every day to realize her greatest dream: to have her own premises and to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: buy thread, zippers etc.

loans.name: Yina Marisol

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Yine, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 30, 23 y 19 años de edad, el menor de ellos estudia en Universidad y dos de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. 

Doña Yine hace años  aprendió corte y confección en un centro en la ciudad, hoy trabaja de maestra en un colegio de la localidad pero también tiene un taller de costura en su casa, allí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 14h00 en el colegio y de allí hasta 22h00 en su taller aunque a veces se queda hasta más tarde si tiene que entregar alguna prenda, tiene más de 10 años con su taller y gracias a Dios le va muy bien. 

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva 10 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda siempre. 

Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y seguir dando sus clases.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the communal bank Amistad meets twice a month. This place is known to be very dynamic where most people work in agriculture and with livestock as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Yina lives here. She is 48 years old. She is married and they have three children 30, 23, and 19 years old. The youngest of them studies at university and two of them are still living with her. Her husband works in agriculture.

Yina years ago learned tailoring at a center in the city. Today she works as a teacher in a local school but she also has a tailoring shop at home. There she works making all types of clothing, working by orders from particular people who know the quality of her work. She works every day from 6:00AM until 2:00PM at school and after that until 10:00PM in her workshop although sometimes she works much later if she has to deliver some outfit. She has had her workshop for more than 10 years and thanks to God she is doing very well.

This is her ninth loan. She is going to use it to buy fabric and other supplies for sewing. She has been with the communal bank for ten years and she likes it because the loans are always a great help.

Her dreams are to have a larger workshop and to continue teaching.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies for her home based tailoring workshop.

loans.name: Julio Oswaldo

texts.es:
Julio tiene 38 años de edad. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que posee playas hermosas, una gastronomía variada, en especial uno de los platillos muy conocidos es el riquísimo “Chupe de Camarones”, también  se desarrolla la agricultura y se cultivan productos como arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros. Julio es padre soltero, con mucha dedicación saca adelante a su pequeña hija de 10 años de edad, por la cual daría la vida con tal de verla feliz. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de educación secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Julio trabaja como albañil, él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 6 clientes diariamente, ya que depende del tamaño de la construcción, el cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es responsable con su trabajo.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para su trabajo como martillo, comba, cinceles, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener las herramientas necesarias para desempeñar su trabajo, así como también mejorar sus ingresos ya que no tendrá que alquilar sus materiales; de esta manera lograra seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia y darle una buena”.
texts.en:
Julio is 38 years old. He lives in the town of Camana which is known for its beautiful beaches, wide range of food (especially the renowned and tasty shrimp soup), and its agriculture. Rice, beans, corn etc. are grown there.

Julio is a single father of a 10-year old daughter whom he has raised with much dedication. He would give his life to see her happy. Because he is poor, he was only able to go grade 5 of secondary school but he would like to have gone to university.

Julio is a builder by trade. He works around ten hours per day and can see up to six customers per day--it all depends on the size of what he is building. He believes his business is going well because he is responsible with his work.

He is very grateful to Kiva donors since it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy tools such as a hammer, sledge hammer, chisels etc. In this way he will have the tools necessary to carry out his work, and he will be able to earn more money as he won’t have to rent equipment. He will be able to continue his daily effort and fulfill his dream of owning his own house and providing his daughter with a good life.

loans.use: buy tools such as a hammer, sledge hammer, chisels etc.

loans.name: Al-Nahtha Group

texts.en: Fatima is a 40-year-old mother who lives with her husband and 8 kids in Hodeida, Yemen. She is the leader of Al-Nahtha Group. She has sold perfume, incense, clothes, sweets and vegetables for 15 years, trying to help her husband with the family's daily expenses. She and her group have applied for a loan of 80,000 YER. With her portion, she will buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and sweets. She hopes that this will boost her income.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfume, incense, clothes and sweets.

loans.name: Al-Mram Group

texts.en: Al-Mram Group is a group of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have requested a loan worth 90,000 YER.  Fatima is a mother of seven children. She has been selling perfumes and incense in order to help provide for her family's basic requirements. Her husband lives in and out of Yemen, so she is  responsible for her family. The loan she has applied for will be used to invest in purchasing perfumes and incense. Fatima hopes to earn a good income, which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes and incense to sell.

loans.name: Al-Nors Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Nors and consists of four women who live in Yemen. Saida, 41, has children and lives with her family in Hodeida, Yemen. For two years, Saida has sold perfumes, incense and clothes. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER to purchase more products and other materials to expand her business. This expansion will help her and her husband to improve their family's life. She and her group have applied for a loan worth 80,000 YER in total.

loans.use: to buy more products and other materials for her perfume and clothes-selling business..

loans.name: Al-Njom Al-Satia Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-njom Al-satia Group. It consists of five ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. Aisha, 42, is the mother of five children. She lives with her family in Hodeida, Yemen. She became the main source of her family's income when her husband became unable to take care of the family due to divorce. She has been selling perfume, incense, and clothes for one year now. To help her continue with her business operations, she has applied for a loan of 20,000 YER. She will use her portion of the group's loan to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfume, incense, clothes, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Ángela Lucia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, viven en su casa pero de forma independiente. Su esposo es operador de maquinaria pesada.

Doña Ángela para obtener sus propios recursos hace mas de 14 años surtió una pequeña tienda en su casa, allí vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, carnes, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo le ayuda en su trabajo sobretodo en las tardes cuando el está desocupado, lleva más de 14 años  con su negocio  y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 14 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Amistad meets in the city of Tosagua twice a month. This place is known to be very dynamic where most people work in agriculture and with livestock as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

Ángela lives here. She is 53 years old. She is married and from this relationship they have four adult children all of them independent but living at home. Her husband is a heavy equipment operator.

Ángela, in order to obtain her own income, more than 14 years ago provisioned her own small store in her home. She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, vegetables and fruits. She works every day from 6:00AM until 8:00PM and sometimes later. Her husband helps her at work especially in the afternoons when he is not working. She has been in business more than 14 years and is doing very well.

This loan is to be used to supply her store. She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staples. She has been with the communal bank 14 years and she likes it because she started her first business with her first loan.

Her goals are to get ahead in business and for her business to grow more each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages, and other staples for her home based grocery store.

loans.name: Om-Hussin Group

texts.en:
Om-Hussin Group consists of five women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Saeeda, 51, lives with her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. After the illness of her children's father, she became the only source of income. 

For three years now, she has been in the business of selling perfumes, incense, and cloth. To help her continue her business operations, Saeeda and her group have applied for a loan of YER 150,000. She will use her portion to buy more quantities of perfumes, incense, cloth and other materials for her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business which, in turn, will allow her to get her own shop.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of perfumes, incense, cloth and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Nancy Rocio

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 13 y 8 años de edad, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura.
 
Doña Nancy con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo el cual no gana mucho con sus actividades en el campo se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo para lo cual instala un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad, lugar en la cual muchos comerciantes ofrecen sus productos, además también se desplaza hasta las ciudades de Bahía y Calceta en los días de ferias ya que es allí donde más personas llegan a estas ciudades y es cuando más vende. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a Guayaquil y Quito cuando necesita surtir su negocio. Tiene más de 7 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su cuarto ciclo  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para seguir adelante.

Su sueño es tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the communal bank "Amistad" meets every 15 days.  This is a dynamic place with lots of vegetation, where most of the residents work in agriculture and raise animals.  

This is where Nancy, 31, lives with her common-law husband and their 2 children aged 13 and 8.  Her children attend middle school and elementary school.  Nancy's husband works in agriculture.

In order to earn something on her own so that she can get ahead and help her husband, who does not earn much as a farmer, Nancy has a business selling all types of clothing.  She sells from her stall in the center of the city, a place where there are a lot of merchants offering their products for sale.  She also goes out to the cities of Bahia and Calceta on market days, because this is when a lot of people come to those cities and the sales are good.  Nancy goes to buy her products in Guayaquil and Quito when she needs to stock up her business.  She has more than 7 years of experience with this business, and it's doing very well.

Nancy will use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing.  This is her 4th loan cycle with her communal bank, and she likes it because they help her to get ahead.

Nancy's dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed, who is 43 years old, was born in Taiz city. He is married and has eight children. He has a diploma degree. He repairs phones. He has a small centre for repairing cell phones. He has been doing this for about three years. Mohammed wants to expand his centre. As he wants to buy a good collection of phone accessories, ink cartridges and printing paper, he has asked for a loan of 200,000 YER. He hopes to move into a bigger centre and have more clients.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories, ink cartridges and printing paper.

loans.name: Orfelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Amistad, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar vive la señora Orfelina, tiene 62 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos todos mayores de edad, una hija vive en su casa. El marido trabaja en un comedor.
 
Doña Orfelia es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Los mismos que vende puerta a puerta, ella trabaja todos los  días ya que además en su casa tiene una pequeña granja de pollos en la cual mete hasta 100 pollos por temporada con lo cual se gana algo extra si salir de su casa. Tiene más de 8  años que se dedica a sus ventas y con la granja mucho más tiempo.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva más de 10 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y en su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua the communal bank Amistad meets twice a month. This place is known to be very dynamic where most people work in agriculture and with livestock as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.
